>>> Hi Matt,
>>>
>>> I saw your message in the Discord and wanted to reach out to you here
>>> (so you know it's official hah) and let you know we have a "secret menu"
>>> $250/mo plan that gives you a 10% discount on credits – you get 27,500
>>> credits for the month and pay 0.90/100 credits thereafter. We're still

>>> already paid $100 for your current plan) and all your existing credit usage
>>> will be covered by the new plan!
>>>
>>> Let me know if you have any questions,
>>> Brandon
>>>
>>

subject: Re: Bryan and Matt Intro
body:
Thanks, Joey!

Bryan, there seems to be a lot of overlap in your mission and ours and I’d
like to learn more about how we might support each other.

Let’s find a time to chat!

Here’s my Calendly: https://calendly.com/mattborn/30min

Best,
Matt

> Whoops. An intro would be more effective if I included both parties. 😆
>
> On Tue, Nov 12, 2024 at 3:13 PM Joey Hendrix <joey@joeyhendrix.com> wrote:
>
>> Hey guys!
>>
>> Bryan, meet Matt!  Matt, meet Bryan!
>>
>> Matt owns a UX/UI design firm here in Salt Lake.
>>
>> Bryan has built a rad product for fractional CFOs to aggregate their
>> client financials in one spot with easy to use reporting and dashboard
>> features.  Bryan mentioned he might need some UX/UI support and thought you
>> two should chat.
>>
>> I'll let you take it from here!
>>
>> Joey
>>
>

subject: Demo with Burke
body:
Hello David!

Thanks again for lunch earlier this week. I really enjoyed your stories and
hearing your passion for the fundamental problems in current gen AI for
enterprise. Hope the 47G event went well!

I just pinged Burke via LinkedIn and was hoping to get that demo scheduled
for today or next week.

Let me know what needs to happen to invade each other’s schedules.

Best,
Matt

subject: Re: Smriti<>Matt Introductions
body:
Smriti!

Thank you so much for your patience. I’ve been drowning and you are my
first follow up since we completed all the interviews. You impressed me so
much and I want to move forward with finding a way to bring you on, but
there have been a few recent headaches that may impact timing. Would love
to hop on a Zoom to chat through some of that at your earliest availability.

Cheers,
Matt

subject: Re: Designer - Donte (Joey Referral)
body:
Hi Donte!

Thanks for taking the time to reach out! Good questions. We’ve paid
$35–100/hr. depending on experience and proficiency. We’ve had a few
designers move into long-term roles in the past and this is always an
option when there is growth. Payroll happens every 2 weeks. We prefer when
new folks stick around for at least 3 months.

Let me know if this sounds good and we can set up a call.

Best,
Matt

On Thu, Aug 15, 2024 at 2:23 PM Donte Davis <donte.davis1@yahoo.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> Could you share a bit more detail on a few things?
>
>
> I'm curious about the pay rate for this project and pay structure. Is it
> hourly, project-based or a flat rate? Knowing the payment schedule would be
> helpful. Also, is there a chance for this role to evolve into something
> more permanent or offer additional responsibilities as the company grows?
> And, how long is the contract expected to last? is there a possibility for
> extensions based on performance and project needs?
>
>
> Looking forward to hearing more about this opportunity!
>
> Donte
>

subject: Forgot to close tab
body:
Hello!

I tried calling but nobody picked up. I was there last night, ordered a
bottle of wine, and forgot to close out. What happens in this case? Is
gratuity automatically applied?

Last name is Born and the last 4 digits of my Visa are 5884.

Thanks,
Matt

>
>
> All exchanges are processed *after* the new product purchase has been
> made; at that point, we will issue the refund for the initial unwanted
> product.
>
> When refunds are processed, they will return to the *original method of
> payment used*. If you originally purchased the product with membership
> credits, your credits will be in your Creative Market account immediately;
> you must have an active membership to use credits. If the product was paid
> for in cash and points, any refund we offer you will be issued entirely in
> points equivalent to the total value of the original transaction. No
> partial cash refunds will be provided.
>
> *If you’d like to proceed with an exchange, please note you have **three
> business days from receiving this email** to make your new purchase. No
> exchanges will be processed after that time. You can read more about our **Exchange
> Policy*
> <https://support.creativemarket.com/hc/en-us/articles/236189908-Refund-Policy#exchange>*
> here. *
>
> All the best,
> Traci
>
> *Customer Support | Creative Market*
>
> *Please note: Support Hours Are From Monday - to Friday, 9 am to 5 pm EST,
> excluding any statutory holidays, and you can expect a reply within 48 to
> 72 business hours of your initial request. For a faster resolution, please
> check out our **Help Center* <https://support.creativemarket.com/hc/en-us>
> *.*
>
>
>

subject: Return Order No. #VG 21820371679
body:
Hello, I'd like help setting up a return for my order. Initially the arch
never arrived and after a few weeks I was told it was on backorder. Then we
went to open our planter boxes and saw they were bent. I was sent a video
showing how this can be corrected but to be quite honest they have
continued to sit in the boxes because we haven't found a replacement arch
that works and also we don't have the time to fix the bent pieces with all
we have going on right now. Can you please set up a return for the entire
order at this time?

Thank you,
Matthew Born

Order No. #VG 21820371679

subject: Re: Austin <> Matt Intro
body:
You can do Matthew Born since I’ll be the only one working on this.
Payments will likely show Moona LLC if we’re going through Stripe, but I am
also happy to set up direct deposit or whatever is best.

FAQ is here: https://moona.design/subscribe/

Thank you!

subject: Re: Austin <> Matt Intro
body:
Hey, Austin!

Thanks for your patience and for following up.

Moona stopped doing contracts altogether in favor of recurring payment up
front and some basic protections on both sides in our public FAQ. The main
ones are typically portfolio rights for us, and discretion with sensitive
data for them. Usually our clients send over their NDAs, tax forms, and
such if they require them so if you have CIAA docs, I’m happy to sign.

Best,
Matt

subject: Re: Re: Order confirmation from Vego Garden
body:
Hi Rachel, as far as the damaged boxes...if we decide to go ahead and fix
them (haven't had the time yet) what will the refund be? Thank you!

On Tue, Apr 2, 2024 at 11:10 AM Vego Garden <hello@vegogarden.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
>   This is Rachel with Vego Garden. I apologize for the delayed response.
> Unfortunately, this does happen sometimes where the panels get bent a
> little bit during transport. We do have a couple of options for this
> situation! We do have a video showing how to easily bend the panels back
> into place in this situation. If the video is helpful and you are happy
> with the outcome, we will issue you a partial refund on the item. If the
> video is not helpful and you are not happy with the product, we will send a
> replacement item as well as a return label to send the damaged item back. I
> will attach the video to this email! Please let me know if this is helpful
> and how you would like to proceed!
>
>
>  https://vimeo.com/583857883/0fd536aa86
>
>
>
> On Sun, 31 Mar at 7:36 PM , Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> We received our Vego beds and unfortunately both boxes arrived with
> damaged metal pieces. I have attached pictures of both damaged sets. We'd
> like to exchange for a new set. Photos attached to the email.
>
> Order No. #VG 21820371679
> *VB9N117TC x2*
>
> Also, I wanted to inquire on the arch trellis as I haven't received
> shipping information for that piece.
>
> Thank you,
> Matt Born
>
> [image: Box 2.jpg]
> [image: Box 1.jpg]
>

subject: Re: Re: Order confirmation from Vego Garden
body:
Yes, please go ahead and refund me and I'll find something else.

thanks for the notice!

On Fri, Apr 12, 2024 at 12:01 PM Vego Garden <hello@vegogarden.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt Born,
>
> Hello, I called to speak with you today about your order for the Arched
> Trellis with order #​21820371679.
> I wanted to let you know that we do not have this item available for
> shipping. I do apologize. Any expected ship date that would be possible
> would be about 60+ days as of right now. Please let me know if you would
> like me to proceed with a refund for this item.
>
> Sincerely,
> Sherany A :)
> Customer Service Representative
> Vegogarden.com <http://vegogarden.com/>
> (866) 597-1888 <8665971888>
> *Follow vego_garden on Instagram for more pictures, comments, discussions
> and updates!*
>
> On Tue, 2 Apr at 12:10 PM , Vego Garden <hello@vegogarden.com> wrote:
> Hi Matt,
>
>   This is Rachel with Vego Garden. I apologize for the delayed response.
> Unfortunately, this does happen sometimes where the panels get bent a
> little bit during transport. We do have a couple of options for this
> situation! We do have a video showing how to easily bend the panels back
> into place in this situation. If the video is helpful and you are happy
> with the outcome, we will issue you a partial refund on the item. If the
> video is not helpful and you are not happy with the product, we will send a
> replacement item as well as a return label to send the damaged item back. I
> will attach the video to this email! Please let me know if this is helpful
> and how you would like to proceed!
>
>
>  https://vimeo.com/583857883/0fd536aa86
>
>
>
> On Sun, 31 Mar at 7:36 PM , Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> We received our Vego beds and unfortunately both boxes arrived with
> damaged metal pieces. I have attached pictures of both damaged sets. We'd
> like to exchange for a new set. Photos attached to the email.
>
> Order No. #VG 21820371679
> *VB9N117TC x2*
>
> Also, I wanted to inquire on the arch trellis as I haven't received
> shipping information for that piece.
>
> Thank you,
> Matt Born
>
> [image: Box 2.jpg]
> [image: Box 1.jpg]
>
> On Thu, Mar 21, 2024 at 2:41 PM Vego Garden <hello@vegogarden.com> wrote:
>
>> Thank you for choosing Vego Garden! We hope your experience at our shop
>> was truly delightful.
>> Welcome to the Vego Garden community, where your satisfaction is our

Oops. The address is 224 Castle Lane, East Peoria, Illinois 61611. Is there
any possibility I can pay a little more for expedited shipping to get here
by Friday? It's for my daughter's birthday. My cell is 309-657-3798 if
that's easier.

Thanks so much!
Megan Born

subject: Re: Your Speechify order
body:
Consider this me contacting you within 7 days. I have no idea why this is
still active. We have tried to cancel this multiple times. It has never
worked for us. Stop charging us!

simeon.kostadinov@speechify-7cf662311281.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

subject: Re: Order confirmation from Vego Garden
Pause services for now
body:
Hi Glen!

Last time we spoke, you mentioned the option to pause our arrangement. I’d
like to try Fruitful.com for the next 90 days to see if that offers some of
what I was hoping to get when we first reached out. This will also give us
more context for how we think about the best way to manage our money.

Any thoughts on Fruitful?

What do we need to do to pause?

Thank you!

Matt

subject: Allegiant Confirmation - MDW to PVU One-way Feb 29
Re: AllClear // DCOM Update
body:
Thanks for the update, Neil!

I’m bummed we won’t be working together because your mindset is always what
I’m looking for in a product partner. Please reach out if you need anything.

In the meantime, we’re about to start promoting our subscription service so
let me know if you or anyone you know would like to learn more:
https://moona.design/subscribe

Happy Thursday!

Cheers,
Matt

subject: Re: Antler Application - Next Steps
body:
Hey Cash!

Love seeing a post about asking for payment from a guy named Cash. ;)

I told you I would follow up once I learned whether I closed that contract
or not. Found out this morning that they went with someone else so I don’t
yet have the budget to cover my expenses in order to commit to the April
cohort.

I’ve got another lead I’m chasing so let me know what the deadline is for
me to get this sorted out.

Thanks for your support!

Matt

subject: Re: Follow Up| Veranda
body:
Thanks for sharing this, Neha!

 Would love to talk through some of the underlying assumptions and
complexities with each of these phases. Where we at on that Slack invite?

Matt

On Fri, Feb 9, 2024 at 2:47 PM Neha Srivastava <nesrivas@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt:
>
> As mentioned, I did some thinking around Crawl, Walk, Run here. Phase 1-3
> UX can be combined if needed.
> 1-4 Tech mostly exists. Should be quick. 2-3 weeks to ship. 1 week UX; 2
> weeks Build.
>
> Tagline: Veranda: Simplify Your Checklist, Find Support From Trusted Moms
> Around You. Focus on What Matters!
> Slogan: Veranda: Pay Moms To Be Moms!
>
> Happy to jump on  a call and share more details.
>
> Phase
> Customer Value Prop
> Demand Goals
> Supply Goals
> Demand Features
> Supply Features
> Enablers
> Phase 1
> Allow Veranda to Consolidate and Clear your Checklist, One Task At a Time.
> Build demand on app via Checklist management.
> Offline: Build supply of moms willing to offer "Mom Skill As a Service"
> Feature 1: Acquire Moms with a Free AI Productivity Tool
> Offline: Build Supply of Moms willing to offer "Mom Skill As a Service"
>  Tech: Onboarding and Home page simplification and Hide All Else. *Low** Tech
> Effort. UX needed.*
> Understand Demand "Types" to Influence Supply via *Concierge *
>
> Feature 2: Access Concierge for Research or Coordinate with any Service or
> Service Provider *for a Fee*
> Offline: Build partners for Concierge
>
> Phase 2
> Verenda-WhatsApp Bot can now coordinate your more tasks - birthday party,
> play date, camp sharing
> Drive Product Led Growth for Demand.
>
> Feature 3: Leverage WhatsApp Bot to drive PLG for Demand via PlayDates,
> Events etc.
> Offline: Accelerate supply of moms willing to offer "Mom Skill As a
> Service" for Categories understood in #1
> Tech: WhatsApp Flow enhance + Web App for Sharing Out
> *Low** Tech Effort.*
> Phase 3
> Monetize your Mom Skills as a Service on Veranda
> *Offline:Test Demand + Supply Match *
> Convert Existing Moms into Service Providers.
>
> Feature 4: List your Mom Skill As a Service via Platform, request
> background checks
> Tech: Home Page - Tab with CTA to Moms. Web App for Referrals.
> *Low** Tech Effort*. *UX needed*
> Phase 4
> Pay Moms to be Moms. Access Backgound Checked Moms providing Services
> Listing of supply for paid subscribers
> Integrate Supply into the platform, put up a pay wall + transactions to
> access.
> Feature 5: Pay Subscription, Search, Transact
> Offline: Build supply of moms willing to offer "Mom Skill As a Service"
> Vendor services + Payments. *Big Tech change. *
> Phase 5
> Supply and Demand Growth
>
>
>
>
>
>
> NextSteps:
>
>    - Time and effort Matt can dedicate
>    - Discuss Terms.
>
>
> Best,
> Neha
>

subject: Re: AllClear // DCOM Update
body:
Hi Neil!

Thanks for getting back to me quickly and sticking with our timeline so I
didn’t have to harass you today. ;)

I’m all for contract-to-hire if it ends up being a good fit all around. If
you want me exclusively with no commitment, I can do 10 hours per week at
$250/hr. billed every 2 weeks, pause or cancel anytime.

Alternatively, you can hire my team at Moona to get more hours starting at
$15k/month with no commitment, pause or cancel anytime. I would lead the
project from our end in that case.

Happy to supply more info to help you out.

Let me know if you want to hop on another call this week. Excited to work
with you!

Cheers,
Matt

subject: Follow up
body:
Paul,

Thank you so much for your time yesterday! It was a quick 15 minutes which
makes it hard to cover anything substantive so I appreciate the offer to
schedule more time in person. I’m only ~20 minutes away from both Lehi and
downtown SLC so it’s easy to venture wherever.

I haven’t seen a Calendly link yet so can you send that over?

Best,
Matt

subject: Re: Congrats on next steps with Redo, Matt!
body:
Thanks, Megan!

Just got off the phone with Paul. It sounded like he was driving and 15
minutes is tough to get into anything substantive, but it sounds like he’s
willing to set up more time in person so I’d say it went well! He told me
to look out for another Calendly link so that’s what I’ll do.

Thanks again for supporting me in this!

Matt

subject: Re: Congrats on next steps with Redo, Matt!
body:
Hi, Megan!

Hope you’ve had a great end to the year! Holiday travel and Christmas took
over so I wasn’t able to schedule this until yesterday. I scheduled it for
Monday, but I’m realizing that it might be better for Tuesday. Let me know
if you think I should bump it.

Matt

subject: Re: Redo Company Info & Resume Request!
body:
Ooh, and another thing I should have mentioned!

I saw on the job posting they were looking for people with experience with
DoorDash, etc. While I haven’t done experience design work for either of
those platforms, DoorDash was a primary reference customer during my time
with Chargeback.com where I studied their business behind the scenes—their
transaction volume, chargeback rate, the nature of their disputes, fraud,
arbitration, etc. and their internal processes for managing such things. My
guess is this would give me a head start on learning the domain.

Matt

subject: Thank you!
body:
Jimmy,

Hope your November is off to a great start. And thank you for your time on
Monday! It was such a pleasure to meet you and share some highlights from
both of our journeys. What you said about not having a product after 26
years moved me in an unexpected way so thanks for your candor.

You mentioned you would connect me with Tricia so I just connected with her
on LinkedIn to get on her radar. I’ll try to get on her calendar next week
if I don’t hear anything.

Let me know if there is anything else you need from me.

Have a great weekend!

All the best,
Matt

subject: Re: Matt Born and Eduardo Mengana
body:
Thanks for the update, Eddie!

I understand. Levels and titles are one thing, and what your hiring team
needs to decide is whether they want a rare combination of cross-cutting
skills that accelerate time to market with high confidence and low
thrashing. If so, that’s me. And you already know I’m flexible on base comp
since quality of life incentives are much more valuable to my family. So
please share my profile more broadly, and trust that I only want to work
with teams that demand high performance without hesitation.

Best,
Matt

subject: TigerFlow® 🐅 Follow-Up Design Work
body:
Hi Michael!

Hope you and Jacob had safe and pleasant travel back to DK! I really
enjoyed our time together last week. Thank you for coordinating everything
and for trusting me to help synthesize and design. It was great to see
everyone come together to bring clarity around the “TigerFlow” customer
journey and strategy for phase 1. 🐅

You mentioned you wanted to “finish” the design and there were a few
requests to see how the new framing might impact some of the other
views—dashboard, catalog, systems, non-pump selections, etc. There’s also
enough time to put an interactive prototype together by ASHRAE to present
to key partners and I believe that will bring even more energy and clarity
to the vision we are shaping.

My team just sent over a proposal and contract based on the month-to-month
basis we mentioned previously for any follow-up work. There’s also an
option to dig a bit deeper and prepare a prototype by ASHRAE that uses live
data.

If you are available, I would love to meet this week to discuss what our
design partnership might look like moving forward. Either book me via
Calendly here <https://calendly.com/mattborn/30min> or let me know what
works for you.

Looking forward to reconnecting!

Best,
Matt

subject: Thank you!
body:
Happy Monday, Anna & Khaled!

I really appreciated our time together on Friday. Thanks for making time
for me in the midst of an insanely busy season.

Also, not sure when I’ll be in SF next, but it’s only a short hop from SLC
that I can make happen at any time if ya’ll want to follow up in person.
Plus Shane and I have been kicking the can on an in-person work sesh for
too long.

Let me know if you have any questions about my work or if there is anything
I can do to help ya’ll out!

Cheers,
Matt

subject: Changes in Resource Allocation and Ending Our Contract
body:
Hi Kristen and Stacey,

I’ve enjoyed our collaborations and appreciate your efforts in helping
manage my life and business for the past few months.

I’m re-evaluating all aspects of my time and business, and I have decided
we’ll discontinue our contract effective immediately. As I focus on new
strategies, I’m exploring several avenues—increasing the number of calls
I’m on each week, seeking in-person collaborators for specific projects,
and as you advised either bringing on a headhunter or an offshore full-time
assistant who can dedicate more time towards the same desired outcomes.

Would love to do an exit interview of sorts to clarify anything that’s
unclear either today or Monday before I leave for Houston if that works for
either of you.

Please let me know the steps needed for a smooth off-boarding process.

Best regards,
Matt

Hey, Eduardo!

I apologize for the confusion. My assistant sent that and didn’t include
that it also depends on equity. In my last founding role, I had 1.8% equity
and based on the revenue model, that had the potential to translate to 7
figures in upside within 5 years. I’d love to still have a conversation to
see if we’re a good fit.

Cheers,
Matt

Michael,

Your customer journey assets were spot on – exactly the kind of groundwork
we need.

Our team has mapped out a plan for our 3-day workshop. The cost, inclusive
of prep and travel, comes to $50,000. We’ll be in Houston from Monday
through Thursday. Given the workshop’s intensity, I’ll be accompanied by
another member of my team for added support.

detailed quote as well as options for an ongoing monthly partnership.

On Fri, Sep 22, 2023 at 11:37 AM Joey Hendrix <
jhendrix@singlestoneconsulting.com> wrote:

> Jimmy meet Matt, Matt meet Jimmy!
>
>
>
> Jimmy, I already gave you a little preamble, but Matt is a good friend of
> mine living in Salt Lake.  He’s been in the UX/UI world for a long time
> working for large companies, startups, and his own consulting firm.  Matt’s
> kiddos are similar ages as ours so we spend a lot of time together
> entertaining our children and keeping each other sane.  ; )
>
>
>
> Matt, Jimmy is our CEO and is on a mission to fully and completely live
> out one of our company’s core, foundational values of being human centric
> in all of our engagements and activities with our clients and our team
> internally.  He’s in the process of building out a robust GTM strategy and
> a focus on digital marketing and lead generation (amidst a whole bunch of
> other things!).  His son would also kick our asses in tennis.  : )
>
>
>
> I know Jimmy’s schedule is a little packed next week, but here are a few
> dates/times that seem available the following.  Let us know if any of these
> work Matt.
>
>
>
> Monday, Oct. 2nd – 3:00, 3:30 Est or 4:30 EST
>
> Tuesday, Oct. 3rd – 1:00, 1:30 or 3:30 EST
>
> Wednesday, Oct. 4th – 1:00-3:00 EST
>
>
>
> I’ll let you two take it from here.  Hope you enjoy the conversation!
>
>
>
> Joey
>
>
>

>

subject: Re: Promissory Note- Profit Interests- Natural Gas to Electricity to Crypto Mining
body:
Will, thank you for all this!

Just got back on the grid so reviewing now. Do you have a perpetuity option
or is everything after December 2025 your personal upside?

On Thu, Aug 10, 2023 at 10:10 AM Will Overly <will@pulse-holdings.com>
wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> Sorry for the delay.
>
> Please find a basic promissory note and profits interest document.
>
> The idea is that you would get paid back your amount ($50,000) in 1 year
> at a 10% interest rate (Oct 2023-Sept 2024) and then starting in October
> 2024-December 2025 you would get your capital provided (proportional to the
> total project capital required).
>
> For example, if you contributed $50,000 out of $550,000 would be 9.09%. If
> the project  generated $10,000 net profit  in a certain month (from
> October 2024- December 2025), you would receive $909 for that month,
> payable in BTC. You are responsible for your own taxes. At the end of the
> profit interest period (December 2025), you would have no right or claim to
> the project or profits.
>
> Please let me know if you have any questions.
> Thanks!
> Will
>

subject: Re: Matt Born materials
body:
Sorry, Joe. Missed this.

My four exits:

   1. Sprout Social December 2019 IPO
   <https://techcrunch.com/2019/12/13/chicagos-sprout-social-prices-ipo-mid-range-at-17-per-share-raising-150m/?guccounter=1>,
   maxed out @ $7B market cap / I was their first product designer and grew
   the design team to 30+
   2. Chargeback acquired by Sift for $66 million in May 2021
   <https://www.pymnts.com/news/acquiring/2021/fraud-prevention-firm-sift-acquiring-dispute-startup-chargeback/>
   / lone designer/director Nov 2020–Aug 2021
   3. Configure One acquired by TA Associates for $100 million in June 2021
   <https://revalizesoftware.com/ta-associates-launches-revalize-a-new-software-platform-for-manufacturers/>
   / lone designer Jan 2019–present
   4. Artemis Health acquired by Nomi Health $200 million in January 2022
   <https://www.axios.com/2022/01/06/nomi-health-acquires-artemis-health>
/ lone
   designer Feb 2019–Sep 2020

Websites/products I’m proud of:

   1. sproutsocial.com
   2. chargeback.com
   3. configureone.com
   4. artemishealth.com
   5. getbambu.com (I built this from scratch in 2014)
   6. meetbigfoot.com (I built this from scratch in 2022)

Let me know what else you need. I’m a veteran generalist who doesn’t fit
neatly in any box who has achieved the most coveted results in the tech
industry multiple times while leading teams of all sizes. If this doesn’t
garner interest, then I don’t have much else.

Best,
Matt

subject: Re: BTC & UER Opportunity
body:
Ok, thanks for taking the additional time to review and advise. I told you
it was a bit esoteric.

Since it’s a promissory note, I think he just needs to prepare something
like this with a 30-month term:
https://www.yieldstreet.com/offering/_FvcCQ/short-term-note-xcviii/

I’ll let you know when it’s time to move funds.

Matt

On Thu, Aug 3, 2023 at 11:06 AM Glen Monroe <glenmonroe@monroewm.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> I took a look at this investment and I have to admit it's a bit out of my
> purview. It looks interesting but I don't have any experience or knowledge
> in this particular area so I'm not sure how to read into this. That being
> said, from a holistic financial planning perspective it's advisable to not
> go above 10% of your networth in one particular investment/stock for risk
> purposes so that is where 50k would be the max I would recommend if you
> decide to proceed.
>
> Best Regards,
> Glen
>
>
>
> On Wed, Aug 2, 2023 at 10:26 AM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:

>> investor group I'm presenting to this afternoon.
>>
>> But structure would be:
>> Minimum return based a promissory note at 10% interest backed by the 3
>> operational projects (3.1 MW already operating) that would flip to a
>> proportional profit interests that would go until the end of December 2025
>> (30 months). The promissory note would be paid back accelerated without
>> penalty that then would flip to profit interests. Upside could be
>> attractive if we go to $120k BTC, while the Put options on the operational
>> projects and projects that would be developed would provide certainty on
>> the revenue front, ensuring the 10% interest payment on the promissory note.
>>
>> If you would like to pass this along you can but I invision him seeing it
>> as a reduction of capital and thus lower fees for him. But welcome you
>> sending it to your Father-in-law or who ever you indicated in your family
>> you wanted to pass it along to.
>> Thoughts?
>> Thanks!
>> Will
>>
>> ---------- Forwarded message ---------
>> From: Will Overly <will@pulse-holdings.com>
>> Date: Thu, Jul 20, 2023 at 7:39 AM
>> Subject: BTC & UER Opportunity

>>

>> investing group call today. I've provided an updated PDF that walks through

>>
>> If this is not what you were looking for please let me know as I don't

>> Will

subject: RE: Case update: PP-R-DYX-491893814
body:
This is absurd. Please provide the documents used to “determined there was
no unauthorized use.”

I had canceled my subscription with *NFL GamePass Deltatre* before the
service was acquired by *DAZN LIMITED* and the subscription was reactivated
at double the rate. Yes, I have emails from the new service, but the NFL
season hasn’t started yet and why would an annual subscription that started
in October charge again in August? Having worked professionally in
chargebacks and fraud, I know changes to the merchant description and an
increased amount is a sure sign of fraudulent activity. Ya’ll need to look
into this more deeply b/c I’m sure I won’t be the only one dealing with
this.

Best,
Matt

Heads up!

Hi Matt, Rikki, and Matt,

We came across issues that will cause your tax filings and payments to fail
with Department of Workforce Services and State Tax Commission if not
corrected. The issues are due to:

   - invalid Department of Workforce Services Account Number for Department
   of Workforce Services
   - invalid State Tax Commission Account Number for State Tax Commission

If these issues aren't resolved, the 2 agencies may assess penalties and
interest for which you'll be liable. We'll also be unable to complete your
tax filings, so as a precaution, your payroll will be blocked in 13 days.
13 days

until payroll is blocked

subject: Re: Intro: Bob <> Shane & Matt
body:
Totally understand!

We should all cut loose, refresh, and celebrate our freedom for a long
weekend and then some.

Don’t worry about us until you have good vibes rolling.

Cheers,
Matt

On Fri, Jun 30, 2023 at 1:56 PM Bob Bass <bob@bbass.co> wrote:

> Hey all,
>
> Shane & Matt - It was great meeting both of you as well. You all seem like
> a very ambitious and smart group of people and I'm interested to see how
> this works out.
>
> Jason - I glanced at your last email and snoozed it. I'll re-open it early
> to mid next week and respond point by point. I'm not sure if I've outright
> said this, or if it's been obvious but I've been burned out since before
> moving, then moving was chaotic, and I've had a very hard time focusing or
> finding my ambition. I'm looking forward to this long weekend and I think
> to fight the burnout I need to disconnect for a few days.
>
> I'm sure that comes off sounding flaky, but I need a clear head to make a
> true commitment and I'm not sure I've had a clear head since moving here.
> If you can hang tight until after the holiday, I'll feel more confident in
> making some decisions. Considering this stuff while I'm actively burning
> out feels almost impossible.
>
> I'll go through my portfolios in the meantime and find something for you
> to reference.
>
> Thanks!
> Bob

subject: Re: Matt <> Amber Intro
body:
Amber!

I’m on a call with Dex right now and realized I missed this email. Would
love to connect with you soon. Here’s my calendly if that works for you or
just let me know! https://calendly.com/mattborn/30min

Best,
Matt

On Wed, May 24, 2023 at 8:18 AM Dexter Horthy <dexter@replicated.com> wrote:

> Hi Amber - finally getting around to introducing you to Matt Born, with
> whom I worked super closely in the Sprout days on a brand new
> "startup-within-the-startup" product experiment. Driving product design,
> Matt was key to helping take this product to market, driving
> extensive prototyping, constant customer feedback, and fast iterations. He
> was quoting Marty Cagan back in 2014—when we read Inspired as a team, I was
> like "wait this all sounds very familiar" [image: 😂] . Overall, Matt's
> role in shaping our product culture was key to getting that new product
> built/shipped and in (paying) customer hands in under a year (? I think
> that's the right number - Matt correct me if that timing is off [image:
> 😅]).
>
> Matt - Amber is the VP of product here at Replicated, and has been key to
> the progress we've made in executing better as a team. Along with our VP of
> engineering, Amber's been very hands-on in transforming our product culture
> to be more customer-centric and focused on prototyping and rapid iteration.
> She's a super thoughtful and knowledgeable product thinker and builder, and
> has had a huge impact on how we build and what we've shipped in the last
> few years.
>
> Amber, I think I mentioned Matt runs a product design consultancy now,
> with a big focus on helping to improve product culture, driving teams
> toward quick iteration and frequent customer conversations. With us pausing
> design hiring, I'm not sure if the timing is right, but I wanted to open
> the door to a quick intro conversation in case there's an opportunity here
> or in the near future. In either case, I'm sure y'all will get along great [image:
> 🙂]
>
> Cheers,
> Dex
>
> __
> *Dexter Horthy*
> Senior Product Manager
> Replicated
> *Want to talk? Let's Talk! <https://calendar.app.google/m5AHmjZT2KYR6x928>*
>
>

On Wed, Jun 7, 2023 at 9:20 AM Matt Johnson <ops@moona.design> wrote:

> Hi Neha:
>
> Totally understand. I hope you will keep us in mind when you get to that

>
> Matt Johnson
> On Jun 6, 2023 at 9:30 PM -0600, nesrivas@bytheveranda.com, wrote:
>
> Matt J:  Thank you so much for getting back to me. While I really wish we
> could work together, that pricing isn’t something I can afford at this
> stage unfortunately. Pray I get funded soon!
>
> Matt B: So excited to know that you are interested in an FT opportunity.
> Would love to chat more. What’s the best way to schedule this?
>
>
>
> Best,
>
> Neha
>
>
>
> *From:* Matt Johnson <ops@moona.design>
> *Sent:* Monday, June 5, 2023 1:51 PM
> *To:* Moona Design <hello@moona.design>; nesrivas@bytheveranda.com
> *Cc:* Moona Design <me@mattborn.com>
> *Subject:* RE: Hello!
>
>
>
> Hi Neha:
>
> We really enjoyed our conversation the other day. Your product is
> compelling and it would definitely be fun to work together. Most recently
> we quoted our services at $20,000 per month for a period of 9 months. We
> will allocate dedicated resources to the project to fit your pacing and
> ensure we can maintain a consistent focus. We are a results-focused firm
> and we firmly believe we can provide the ROI you're looking for at this
> price point. I am happy to discuss contract length, weekly commitment, or
> other details and adjust the agreement for what suits your needs as we are
> able.
>
> On another note, Matt Born is interested in discussing the FT role of CTO
> with you. I think the two of you should chat further to discuss what it
> could look like.
>
>
> Matt Johnson
>
> COO
>
> Moona Design
>
> On Jun 3, 2023 at 7:16 AM -0600, nesrivas@bytheveranda.com, wrote:
>
> Hi Matt:
>
>
>
> Hope you’ve been well.  I enjoyed meeting you both.
>
> Was reflecting on our chat and realized I need to do a better job of
> articulating immediate need:
>
>
>
>    - A conversational Bot, enabling parents to give requests. (Signal
>    Play Date, Signal Book Trade, Give me Activities to keep kids busy). I want
>    to do X with Y
>    - A few following pages that are templates with options:
>
>
>    - You can do X, with Y, at Z
>       - Actions Bookmark, send to others in chat and notify and if
>       accepted (calendar for all), calendar (for self)
>
>
> This is still loose, and I can share more detailed stories; however, will
> love to get a sense of budget etc. before I proceed.
>
>
>
> Best,
>
> Neha
>
> *From:* Moona Design <hello@moona.design>
> *Sent:* Thursday, May 25, 2023 9:11 AM
> *To:* Neha <nesrivas@bytheveranda.com>
> *Cc:* Matt Johnson <ops@moona.design>; Moona Design <me@mattborn.com>
> *Subject:* Re: Hello!
>
>
>
> Hi Neha,
>
>
>
> I apologize in my last email your name was wrong. I think autocorrect got
> me on that one.
>
>
>
> I believe we can do 12pm PST. Let me double check with my team, but let's
> tentatively plan on that.
>
>
>
> On Thu, May 25, 2023 at 8:24 AM Neha <nesrivas@bytheveranda.com> wrote:
>
> Hi Matt,
>
>
>
> I am flying out today. Does any window from 12-2 PST work for you?
>
>
>
> Best,
>
> Neha
>
>
> ------------------------------
>
> *From:* Moona Design <hello@moona.design>
> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 24, 2023 12:58 PM
> *To:* nesrivas@bytheveranda.com <nesrivas@bytheveranda.com>
> *Cc:* Matt Johnson <ops@moona.design>; Moona Design <me@mattborn.com>
> *Subject:* Re: Hello!
>
>
>
> Hi Reha,
>
>
>
> Thanks for your patience in our response. I've been out of town since
> Thursday of last week and I'm just getting back into the swing of things
> today. We are definitely open to have a quick sync to chat through all of
> that. Would tomorrow afternoon around 3:30pm MST work for you? Myself and
> Matt Born, our Principal Product Designer that did the work for Bigfoot,
> would be present.
>
>
>
> Matt Johnson
>
> COO
>
> Moona Design
>
>
>
> On Sat, May 20, 2023 at 12:28 PM <nesrivas@bytheveranda.com> wrote:
>
> Matt:
>
>
>
> I have a product in Test Flight. There is work to be done on buttoning
> that up, but more so adding new workflows.
>
> I’d love a 30 minute check in call so that I can demo what the current
> project is and share the vision.
>
>
>
> I am very excited to talk to you.
>
>
>
> Best,
>
> Neha
>
>
>
> *From:* Moona Design <hello@moona.design>
> *Sent:* Saturday, May 20, 2023 4:54 AM
> *To:* nesrivas@bytheveranda.com; Matt Johnson <ops@moona.design>; Moona
> Design <me@mattborn.com>
> *Subject:* Re: Hello!
>
>
>
> Hi Neha,
>
>
> Thank you for reaching out to us and expressing your interest in
> partnering with Moona Design. We're glad to know you like the design of
> Bigfoot!
>
>
> We are excited to learn more about Veranda and explore how we can
> collaborate to enhance the user experience of your product. In order to
> better understand your needs and goals, it would be helpful if you could
> provide us with some additional information. Here are a few key points we
> would like to know:
>
>    1. Briefly describe Veranda and its purpose. What problem does it
>    solve or what value does it offer to its users?
>    2. What stage is Veranda currently at? Are you in the early
>    development phase, launching soon, or already live in the market?
>    3. What specific areas or aspects of Veranda's user experience are you
>    seeking assistance with? Are there any pain points or challenges that you
>    would like us to address?
>    4. Do you have any specific timelines or deadlines in mind for this
>    collaboration? Understanding your time frame will help us plan and allocate
>    resources accordingly.
>    5. Finally, if there are any specific expectations or goals you have
>    in mind for our partnership, please feel free to share them with us. It
>    could be anything from improving user engagement to optimizing the
>    onboarding process, or even conducting usability testing.
>
> If it would work better for you, we are more than happy to have an initial
> zoom call to discuss these points synchronously as a way to get started,
> but please feel free to respond to this email with your answers. Once we
> have a clear understanding of your requirements, we can discuss the next
> steps and provide you with a tailored proposal that aligns with your goals.
>
> We look forward to hearing more about Veranda and the opportunity to
> collaborate. If you have any additional information or documents that you
> believe would be helpful for us to review, please don't hesitate to share
> them.
>
> Thank you once again for considering our services. We're excited about the
> potential partnership and the positive impact we can create together.
> Best regards,
>
> Matt Johnson
>
> COO
>
> Moona Design
>
>

subject: Changes to membership
body:
Hi, Lauren!

After a couple visits and over a month going by since her last visit, my
wife came to realize that she isn’t going to be able to take advantage of
her add-on membership as we originally hoped. Are we able to drop her
$100/mo. add-on while preserving my membership and 12-month commitment?
What are the steps we need to take?

Thank you for your time and care,
Matt

subject: Cancel plz
body:
Hi! I haven’t used this at all since first trying it out and it rarely
worked in Google Docs so can you please cancel my subscription and refund
this charge or provide directions on how I can do so?

Thank you!

Matt

subject: Re: Financial Advising
body:
Hey, Mark!

Please excuse the delayed response. Had Covid shortly after this email was
sent and lost track of a few things. Would love to chat with you. Full
disclosure, I’m generally distrusting and hesitant towards financial
planner type folks due to past experience and a laundry list of reasons
I’ve already shared with Matt. That said, I am very interested in getting
more help with financial decisions because we are currently underserved and
especially motivated so would love to learn more about you and your
practice. I have lots of availability in the next week.

Talk soon,
Matt

On Fri, Feb 10, 2023 at 10:48 AM Mark Parrett <mark@outpostadvisors.net>
wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> Thanks for the connection Matt (Johnson)! Moving you over to cc.
>
> Matt, I work with quite a few business owners in the web design/build and
> digital product space. I'd love to chat about how we might be able to help
> you with some financial planning if that's something you're needing at the
> moment. If you're around, I always enjoy face to face and would be happy to
> grab a coffee and chat. If not, a zoom meeting works great as well. Is
> there a time in the next week or so that works for you?
>
> You can read up on my firm here in the meantime.
> <http://www.outpostadvisors.net>
>
> Talk soon,
> Mark Parrett

subject: Membership
body:
Hi Lindsay!

I called and spoke to Lauren last Friday to see if we would be able to
visit on Saturday. She said an email would be going out, but we haven’t
received it yet. Got your member email today and was curious if that was
something we are still waiting on or whether there might have been an issue.

Looking forward to our first visit!

Matt

subject: First visit
body:
Hi, Lauren!

My wife and I are excited about our membership and we were wondering if it
would be possible to have our first visit tomorrow night since we have
sitter even though we won’t have our membership card, yet. Let us know if
this is possible, and what we should do.

Thank you for your help!

Matt

subject: Re: Social work research and AI tools - initial thoughts
body:
This is a great start! Thanks for putting this together. The image makes a
lot more sense now. I love the idea of playing a match game between
questions and technologies.

On Tue, Jan 17, 2023 at 2:41 PM ELIZABETH HENDRIX <
Elizabeth.Hendrix@utah.edu> wrote:

> Hi! Okay, here's my initial brain dump.
>
> A quick review of the literature shows that a handful of researchers are
> starting to examine the intersection of AI and social work, and I think we
> can divide this into three domains: Social work education, social work
> practice, and social work research. I can send you a bunch of articles (I
> have to download them as PDFs so you can access them), there are a handful
> on how AI shapes social work education - what we include in the curriculum,
> as well as how the curriculum is delivered. In terms of practice, I found
> one article about internet+ and how it might be used for virtual home
> visits, for example. Practice uses would also include things like
> predicting intimate partner violence perpetration or substance use relapse.
> So far I have found a few interesting articles in the research domain, and
> that's where we'll go.
>
> I imagine this as sort of a primer for social work researchers who want to
> begin to use these novel tools that are becoming more user-friendly. We
> could structure this as a survey of 3-4 tools that researchers could use
> (or even ways of thinking about research methods that are not traditional
> within social work). Ideally, these are tools that don't require extensive
> training to use and are not prohibitively expensive to use. If we are able
> to apply them to research questions in the manuscript (like, actually do
> the research) I think that's encouraged.
>
> My initial thought is to submit this as Methodological Note in Journal of
> the Society for Social Work and Research (
> https://www.journals.uchicago.edu/journals/jsswr/instruct#guidelines-methodological),
> but I'll look around some more.
>
> I also scribbled down a little about the research methods social work
> generally uses, I think if we look at some of the types of questions people
> are trying to answer, you can help match tech capabilities to those
> questions. I texted you.
>
> It's a start...
>
> Elizabeth
>
> ------------------------------
> *From:* Elizabeth <elizabeth.w.hendrix@gmail.com>
> *Sent:* Tuesday, January 17, 2023 12:33 PM
> *To:* ELIZABETH HENDRIX <Elizabeth.Hendrix@utah.edu>
> *Subject:* Social work research and AI tools - initial thoughts
>
>
> Social Work Research and AI
>
>
> What does the evolution of AI and machine learning mean for social work?
> Research and practice implications, this article will focus on research and
> use of AI technology in social work research.
>
>
> AI is a broad term that encompasses technologies including [XYZ].
>
>
> The advent of tools that can…
>
>
> Ethical considerations
>
> Augment our ability to gain meaningful insights from complex human data in
> a way that can inform and guide new interventions.
>
>
> To that end, this methodological note highlights three tools that utilize
> AI/machine learning and illustrates ways in which social work researchers
> can integrate them into their methodological toolkits.
>
>
>

subject: Fwd: [Action Required] Sprout Social issued Shareworks Account Being Removed
body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sprout Equity <equity@sproutsocial.com>
Date: Tue, Oct 25, 2022 at 8:02 AM
Subject: [Action Required] Sprout Social issued Shareworks Account Being
Removed
To:


Hello from Sprout Social,

I hope you are well.  You are receiving this email because Sprout has
chosen to move on from our current equity provider, Shareworks, and our
records indicate that you still have shares of SPT and/or cash in your
Shareworks account.  These assets must be transferred out of your account
or sold prior to December 15, 2022.

You can access your Shareworks account by navigating to shareworks.com and
clicking on the login button on the top right.  If you are accessing your
account for the first time, click reset password and use your Shareworks
account number and your personal email address to reset your log in.

Once accessed, you have the choice of either transferring your shares to
another broker or selling your shares for cash and withdrawing the funds.

If this is not completed by December 15, 2022 your shares will be returned
to our transfer agent, Equiniti, where your shares will remain until you
claim them in a multi-stepped process.

We appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and we hope you are
doing well in your endeavors!


Best Regard,

--

Owen Clements | Pronouns: He/Him/His

Stock Plan Administrator

Sprout Social <https://sproutsocial.com/>

781.985.5443 mobile

*@OwenClements <https://www.linkedin.com/in/owen-clements-4b938b4a/>*

<https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Sprout-Social-EI_IE701678.11,24.htm>

<https://fortune.com/best-medium-workplaces/2020/sprout-social/>

was Salt Lake City was being used instead of Cottonwood Heights for the
city name. This usually happens when systems autocomplete the address, and
both are valid mailing addresses. Assuming this is what happened, but is
this why it would fail?

Why would it be failing now?

Thanks for your help!

Matt

subject: Shipped to incorrect address
body:
Hello! I had changed my default address for shipping in June as we were
traveling and I wanted to receive it on our travels. On 6/30 I changed the
default address back to my home address but the bag shipped on 7/2 and went
to the wrong address in East Peoria, Il. I checked my addresses again and
my home address in Utah was selected as default so I assumed I just missed
the cutoff. I’m waiting on a new bag so I just checked and saw this one is
once again shipping to an address that was not selected as default. That is
two bags I have missed because of an error on your end / website. Can you
let me know how this will be made right?

I did make sure to delete the other addresses so it doesn’t happen with
future shipments but I would like a refund or similar for the two bags that
were mis-shipped.

Thank you,
Matt Born

subject: Re: Employment docs
body:
Ok, it makes sense. I’m comfortable signing without more back-and-forth
with legal. The three relevant tools that came to mind are Figma, GitHub,
and Google Drive. Any design or code work on any of my local devices is
also in the cloud via one of those services. I will have non-Bigfoot work
on all of them in perpetuity. Some specific examples include all design
files under the Moona Design team in Figma, design work for my church in
Google Drive, and past client/pet projects on GitHub. I’ve never done
anything with ranking algorithms and I expect Bigfoot to own anything I
create for that. I expect Bigfoot to own anything I design under the
Bigfoot Figma team license, any new commits to Bigfoot-owned repos on
GitHub, and any new documents/files in Google Drive associated with
matt@meetbigfoot.com.

Does this sound right to you?

Matt

subject: Re: Flipboard -Next Steps/ Zoom Interview Availability- Portfolio Review
body:
Hi Pam and Val!

I received Pam’s voicemail, and I have decided to move forward with my
other offer to lead design for a tiny startup. Thank you both for all your
support the past month. I appreciate the time everyone dedicated to
considering me for Flipboard. I still think it’s a great opportunity and I
am excited for the Flipboard 5 team to find a great designer to lead the
effort. Perhaps we will cross paths in the future!

All the best,
Matt

On Tue, Jun 21, 2022 at 1:12 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:

> Thank you! I haven’t signed anything yet and they know I’m traveling this
> week so we have some time.
>
> On Tue, Jun 21, 2022 at 1:07 PM Pam Hart <pam@flipboard.com> wrote:
>
>> Thanks Matt,
>> Congrats on your pending offer. We will move as quickly as possible to
>> get you through our process! Do you have a deadline to respond to your
>> offer or can you ask for an extension?
>>
>> *Pam Hart*
>> *Head of Talent Acquisition @ Flipboard* *•* Careers @ Flipboard
>> <https://about.flipboard.com/careers/>*• Life @ Flipboard
>> <http://flip.it/JsnGsu>**•*415-509-2221
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> On Tue, Jun 21, 2022 at 10:09 AM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>
>>> Hi Val and Pam!
>>>
>>> Thank you both for all your support throughout this process. I am pretty
>>> flexible this week and I am available tomorrow afternoon and Thursday and
>>> Friday morning. I wanted to give you and the hiring team a heads up that I
>>> have an offer I am considering which presses on our timing. I really
>>> enjoyed my time with Dan and Patrick and was hoping to meet more of the
>>> team, but I don’t want to waste anyone’s time if I’m not the front runner
>>> for the position and we are still a ways out from the team reaching a
>>> decision.
>>>
>>> Please share this with your team and let me know how you want to move
>>> forward.
>>>
>>> Thank you for your time and consideration thus far!
>>>
>>> Cheers,
>>> Matt
>>>
>>> On Fri, Jun 17, 2022 at 4:36 PM Valerie Olmeda <volmeda@flipboard.com>
>>> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Hi Matt,
>>>>
>>>> I hope all is well with you!  I'm reaching out to get your availability
>>>> for a 60-minute Zoom interview/ *Portfolio Review*
>>>>
>>>> Please let me know your availability for a 60-minute Zoom interview!
>>>>
>>>> Looking forward to hearing from you soon, Matt!
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> Best,
>>>> Val
>>>
>>>

subject: Re: Offer for Full Time Employment at Bigfoot
body:
Heads up, I still don’t see a Google Workspace invite. Would you mind
sending it again?

Thank you!

>> with materials and other things.  There are a few questions in there for
>> you to answer as well (just place comments in the doc).
>>

>> thoughts or ideas - please call them out.
>>
>> Excited to get things fired up this week!
>> Alex
>>

>>

>>> create and build in the coming years.. and Design will be at the heart of
>>> it all.
>>>
>>> I'm 8 hours ahead of you now, but shoot me a text when you get 10 mins
>>> today and can talk.  Wanted to quickly talk through a couple things in
>>> advance of the big upcoming Chi>SLC road trip.
>>>
>>> A
>>>

>>> wrote:

>>>> Excellent news! So excited to have you onboard Matt, and I can’t wait

>>>>>
>>>>> Thanks and look forward to connecting soon!
>>>>>
>>>>> JC
>>>>>
>>>>> Sent from my iPhone
>>>>>
>>>>> On Jun 18, 2022, at 1:30 PM, Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>> ﻿
>>>>> Alex, thank you for your time yesterday and for moving quickly! This
>>>>> is a meaningful update. My family and I are really excited about this
>>>>> opportunity. I’d like to move forward with accepting the offer so let me
>>>>> know next steps. Enjoy your last day in Chicago and safe travels!
>>>>>
>>>>> Talk soon,
>>>>> Matt
>>>>>
>>>>> P.S. Two of my girls found Bigfoot lurking behind a building this
>>>>> morning…
>>>>>
>>>>> <IMG_1121-min.jpg>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> On Fri, Jun 17, 2022 at 4:22 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com>
>>>>> wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>>> Matt -
>>>>>> Thanks for the call earlier.  Hope it was helpful.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Shane, JC, and I synced up and wanted to get back to you as soon as
>>>>>> we came to an agreement. Here is where we landed on the 3 key pieces you
>>>>>> asked about:
>>>>>>
>>>>>>    1. We talked through it and believe we'll be able to increase
>>>>>>    your equity allocation by almost 30%, to 1.8% ownership of the company
>>>>>>    2. For targeted salary increases after we raise a successful Seed
>>>>>>    round, it's almost impossible to say right now. Mainly because there are so
>>>>>>    many factors and so much variability with what we will raise and how the
>>>>>>    market for Seed companies will look in 2023
>>>>>>    3. We can say that for our leadership team, we would ideally like
>>>>>>    to target around 10-20% increases next year from 2022 base salaries.. but
>>>>>>    just we can't be held to that.  It may well also depend on stipulations
>>>>>>    with lead investors in the round
>>>>>>    4. We also can commit to providing at least 3 months for a WeWork
>>>>>>    membership as your home office is getting built
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We hope this is meaningful to you, and are excited about the
>>>>>> possibility of you building Bigfoot alongside us. There is so much great
>>>>>> stuff to get done, and design is foundational to our success.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> - Alex, Shane, & JC
>>>>>>
>>>>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 8:14 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>>>>>
>>>>>>> This is great, thank you!
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 5:59 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com>
>>>>>>> wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Absolutely, just ask that you please not share the below with
>>>>>>>> anyone.  Hopefully it will give you a deeper sense of all the great backers
>>>>>>>> we have and opportunity ahead of us.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Here's the last full investor deck
>>>>>>>> <https://docsend.com/view/te48sq6sgbtna4ev> from Q1 (just add this
>>>>>>>> email to access).
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Below is our list of investors -- not fully comprehensive as there
>>>>>>>> are some other senior investors. This is what we typically share with new
>>>>>>>> employees if they want to meet with a couple in particular.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>    - The founder of a leading, late-stage APAC VC (Soo Boon Koh
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/soo-boon-koh-14110b> of iGlobe -
>>>>>>>>    great Bloomberg article about her here
>>>>>>>>    <https://archive.vn/pgEaT>)
>>>>>>>>    - Founder of an SF-based investment syndicate and UX & design
>>>>>>>>    leader at Google (Rick Johanson
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.invisible-ventures.com/>)
>>>>>>>>    - Founder of a UK-based early-stage venture firm; One of the
>>>>>>>>    first investors in 2 large cap tech companies (Paul Heydon
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/pheydon/>)
>>>>>>>>    - Chief Business Officer at a ~$3B valuation travel platform,
>>>>>>>>    and former Co-Lead for Airbnb Experiences (Jules Persaud
>>>>>>>>    <https://uk.linkedin.com/in/julianpersaud>)
>>>>>>>>    - CEO/founder of a quickly growing, EU-based, home rental
>>>>>>>>    platform (Series A) (Stan Fourteau
>>>>>>>>    <https://techcrunch.com/2021/09/23/as-remote-work-becomes-normal-ukio-raises-9m-for-premium-long-term-rentals/>
>>>>>>>>    )
>>>>>>>>    - CEO/founder of a quickly growing, EU-based, fintech and HR
>>>>>>>>    SaaS product (Series A) (Borja Aranguren
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.eu-startups.com/2021/07/madrid-based-cobee-raises-e14-million-to-double-down-on-its-mission-to-improve-access-to-employee-benefits/>
>>>>>>>>    )
>>>>>>>>    - CEO/founder of a global tech education and coding bootcamp
>>>>>>>>    platform (Series B) (Gonzalo
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/gonzalomanrique> Manrique
>>>>>>>>    <https://archive.vn/aWeBm>)
>>>>>>>>    - CEO/founder of a US proptech and management firm (Sonder
>>>>>>>>    competitor) (Toivo Halvorsen
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/toivohalvorsen/>)
>>>>>>>>    - CPO/founder of a global commercial & consumer space rental
>>>>>>>>    marketplace (Series C, ~$500M valuation) (Rony
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/rony-chammas/> Chammas
>>>>>>>>    <https://venturebeat.com/2017/03/06/peerspace-raises-11-million-to-provide-original-event-locations/>
>>>>>>>>    )
>>>>>>>>    - Cofounders / Investment Leads at APX Ventures
>>>>>>>>    <https://apx.vc/who-we-are> - a well regarded pre-seed fund
>>>>>>>>    based in Berlin
>>>>>>>>    - Head of Spain / Portugal for Trade Republic, Accel Partners
>>>>>>>>    Scout Fund (Kintxo Cortes
>>>>>>>>    <https://es.linkedin.com/in/kintxocortes>)
>>>>>>>>    - Partner at a major US-based, late stage VC (Javier Morenes
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/javier-morenes-92bb20126/>)
>>>>>>>>    - Global Head of M&A at Social Capital (Ravi
>>>>>>>>    <https://twitter.com/rtanuku> Tanuku
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/ravi-tanuku-92a754/>)
>>>>>>>>    - Partner at a Chicago-based, late stage investment fund (Jonathan
>>>>>>>>    Glick <https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathan-glick-b69251/>)
>>>>>>>>    - Founder of a US-based late stage investment & advisory fund (
>>>>>>>>    Michael <https://www.linkedin.com/company/medialink/> Kassan
>>>>>>>>    <https://deadline.com/2021/12/uta-medialink-purchase-jeremy-zimmer-michael-kassan-1234891998/>
>>>>>>>>    )
>>>>>>>>    - Founder at an EU-based real estate development fund (Esteve
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/estevealmirall/> Almirall
>>>>>>>>    <https://realassets.ipe.com/news/global-co-living-specialist-node-expands-with-starcity-spain-takeover/10056911.article>
>>>>>>>>    )
>>>>>>>>    - Former Vice Chairman & President of Conway Technology Group
>>>>>>>>    (Xerox) (James Conway <https://conwayoffice.com/about/>)
>>>>>>>>    - Former Chairman of Univision and CEO of a global advertising
>>>>>>>>    agency (Joe Uva
>>>>>>>>    <https://www.forbes.com/sites/courtstroud/2020/11/30/the-advice-former-univision-ceo-joe-uva-would-give-new-ceo-wade-davis/?sh=3538529928d4>
>>>>>>>>    )
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Happy to share anything else!
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 2:05 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Hey, in the meantime, could you share those investor decks?
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 1:20 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Alex!
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Thank you so much for going to bat for me. It’s been a pleasure
>>>>>>>>>> getting to know you and Shane, and learning more about the vision, so I am
>>>>>>>>>> excited about this offer!
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> *Give me 24 hours to share this update with my inner circle
>>>>>>>>>> before making a decision.* I also have follow up interviews
>>>>>>>>>> already scheduled with a handful of other companies tomorrow and next week,
>>>>>>>>>> so I’ll need to figure out what I’m going to do about that as well. :)
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Feeling great about the future!
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Cheers,
>>>>>>>>>> Matt
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 12:56 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com>
>>>>>>>>>> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Matt -
>>>>>>>>>>> It was really great connecting with you on Tuesday. I'm adding
>>>>>>>>>>> our cofounders - Shane and JC - as we're really excited to be able to make
>>>>>>>>>>> you a formal offer to join us in building out the future of Bigfoot!
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> We've been working on the best offer that we can pull
>>>>>>>>>>> together, at least for the next 9-12 months before we raise our Seed round.
>>>>>>>>>>> Given our planned out budget from the first raise for 2022, it looks like
>>>>>>>>>>> we will be able to carve out $160,000 as an initial annual salary.  We've
>>>>>>>>>>> also been using a site called Option Impact by Morgan Stanley
>>>>>>>>>>> <https://www.shareworks.com/product/option-impact/> to
>>>>>>>>>>> benchmark vs other early stage tech companies.  And while according to that
>>>>>>>>>>> this salary would be in the 75th percentile or higher for Seed-Stage,
>>>>>>>>>>> C-Level Product / Design Officers... we do completely understand how this
>>>>>>>>>>> is lower than what you have been seeing.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> However, we do think you are a perfect fit for who we're looking
>>>>>>>>>>> to lead all of our product design, and build out this division well into
>>>>>>>>>>> the future. So we want to make sure you know a few other things:
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>    1. This doesn't account for equity. In addition to that
>>>>>>>>>>>    initial salary, we also expect to be able to offer you equity currently
>>>>>>>>>>>    worth 1.4% of the company. This will vest over 4 years - the same vesting
>>>>>>>>>>>    schedule for all equity holding leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>>    2. As we discussed, this will be meaningful equity. The
>>>>>>>>>>>    strike price on these options will be very low since things are still so
>>>>>>>>>>>    early on in fundraising. And with the team we have in place, the incredible
>>>>>>>>>>>    investors already backing us, and the vision / opportunity that we're
>>>>>>>>>>>    building towards, we believe we have something special with enormous
>>>>>>>>>>>    upside. It is exactly why I am not taking any salary until our Seed round
>>>>>>>>>>>    -- because I wanted more equity for long term value.
>>>>>>>>>>>    3. We can also ensure in any employment agreement that, once
>>>>>>>>>>>    we raise the Seed, we can seek to adjust your salary higher. We can use the
>>>>>>>>>>>    same language that we included in our agreement with our Head of Marketing
>>>>>>>>>>>    4. We provide competitive health insurance benefits in the
>>>>>>>>>>>    U.S. through Gusto. We are also absolutely fine with you taking personal or
>>>>>>>>>>>    family time off as needed, as long as it is reasonable and doesn't impact
>>>>>>>>>>>    the overall quality of your work
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Please take some time to think through things, and we're always
>>>>>>>>>>> reachable via phone / whatsapp / in person (until Sunday afternoon) to
>>>>>>>>>>> answer any questions. And if you need anything else from us to make a
>>>>>>>>>>> more thoughtful decision, happy to send you investor decks, the investor
>>>>>>>>>>> update we sent about 6 weeks ago, or our investor list.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Hope you are as excited as we are about this Leadership Role to
>>>>>>>>>>> help us build and scale Bigfoot into everything we know it can be!
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Best,
>>>>>>>>>>> Alex, JC, and Shane
>>>>>>>>>>> --
>>>>>>>>>>> *Alex Ward | **Co-Founder*
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> US / Whatsapp: +1 202 9049585
>>>>>>>>>>> EU: +34 627 297013
>>>>>>>>>>> MeetBigfoot.com
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>

subject: Re: Handshake: Update
body:
Hi, Amy!

Yes, feel free to call my number any time. 847 347 4463

Matt

On Mon, Jun 27, 2022 at 11:56 AM Amy Hayes <ahayes@joinhandshake.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> I have an update for you, do you have time for a brief call today?
>
> Amy
>
> --
>
>
>
>
> Amy Hayes
>
>   Senior Design Recruiter
>
>   Handshake
>
>   she/her/hers
>
>   www.joinhandshake.com
>
>   💥  We just announced our $200M Series F funding!
>
> *Join Team Handshake* <https://joinhandshake.com/careers>
>
> *Please note our upcoming company-wide OOO:*
> Collectively, Handshake will be closed *July 4th - July 8th* to allow our
> employees time to reset and recharge. During this time we will not be
> conducting or scheduling interviews. If you anticipate this may cause an
> issue in your interview timeline, please let us know right away. Otherwise,
> we look forward to connecting once we are back online, Monday, July 11!
>

>>>>>>>>> Thank you so much for going to bat for me. It’s been a pleasure
>>>>>>>>> getting to know you and Shane, and learning more about the vision, so I am
>>>>>>>>> excited about this offer!
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> *Give me 24 hours to share this update with my inner circle before
>>>>>>>>> making a decision.* I also have follow up interviews already
>>>>>>>>> scheduled with a handful of other companies tomorrow and next week, so I’ll
>>>>>>>>> need to figure out what I’m going to do about that as well. :)
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Feeling great about the future!
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Cheers,
>>>>>>>>> Matt
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 12:56 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com>
>>>>>>>>> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Matt -
>>>>>>>>>> It was really great connecting with you on Tuesday. I'm adding
>>>>>>>>>> our cofounders - Shane and JC - as we're really excited to be able to make
>>>>>>>>>> you a formal offer to join us in building out the future of Bigfoot!
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> We've been working on the best offer that we can pull
>>>>>>>>>> together, at least for the next 9-12 months before we raise our Seed round.
>>>>>>>>>> Given our planned out budget from the first raise for 2022, it looks like
>>>>>>>>>> we will be able to carve out $160,000 as an initial annual salary.  We've
>>>>>>>>>> also been using a site called Option Impact by Morgan Stanley
>>>>>>>>>> <https://www.shareworks.com/product/option-impact/> to benchmark
>>>>>>>>>> vs other early stage tech companies.  And while according to that this
>>>>>>>>>> salary would be in the 75th percentile or higher for Seed-Stage, C-Level
>>>>>>>>>> Product / Design Officers... we do completely understand how this is lower
>>>>>>>>>> than what you have been seeing.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> However, we do think you are a perfect fit for who we're looking
>>>>>>>>>> to lead all of our product design, and build out this division well into
>>>>>>>>>> the future. So we want to make sure you know a few other things:
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>    1. This doesn't account for equity. In addition to that
>>>>>>>>>>    initial salary, we also expect to be able to offer you equity currently
>>>>>>>>>>    worth 1.4% of the company. This will vest over 4 years - the same vesting
>>>>>>>>>>    schedule for all equity holding leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>    2. As we discussed, this will be meaningful equity. The
>>>>>>>>>>    strike price on these options will be very low since things are still so
>>>>>>>>>>    early on in fundraising. And with the team we have in place, the incredible
>>>>>>>>>>    investors already backing us, and the vision / opportunity that we're
>>>>>>>>>>    building towards, we believe we have something special with enormous
>>>>>>>>>>    upside. It is exactly why I am not taking any salary until our Seed round
>>>>>>>>>>    -- because I wanted more equity for long term value.
>>>>>>>>>>    3. We can also ensure in any employment agreement that, once
>>>>>>>>>>    we raise the Seed, we can seek to adjust your salary higher. We can use the
>>>>>>>>>>    same language that we included in our agreement with our Head of Marketing
>>>>>>>>>>    4. We provide competitive health insurance benefits in the
>>>>>>>>>>    U.S. through Gusto. We are also absolutely fine with you taking personal or
>>>>>>>>>>    family time off as needed, as long as it is reasonable and doesn't impact
>>>>>>>>>>    the overall quality of your work
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Please take some time to think through things, and we're always
>>>>>>>>>> reachable via phone / whatsapp / in person (until Sunday afternoon) to
>>>>>>>>>> answer any questions. And if you need anything else from us to make a
>>>>>>>>>> more thoughtful decision, happy to send you investor decks, the investor
>>>>>>>>>> update we sent about 6 weeks ago, or our investor list.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Hope you are as excited as we are about this Leadership Role to
>>>>>>>>>> help us build and scale Bigfoot into everything we know it can be!
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Best,
>>>>>>>>>> Alex, JC, and Shane
>>>>>>>>>> --
>>>>>>>>>> *Alex Ward | **Co-Founder*
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> US / Whatsapp: +1 202 9049585
>>>>>>>>>> EU: +34 627 297013
>>>>>>>>>> MeetBigfoot.com
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>

subject: Re: Next Steps: Critique Exercise | Matt Born
body:
No worries! I understand. I’ve been traveling all over Chicagoland today so
didn’t have another availability. I really appreciate all the time the team
was willing to take getting to know me. Hope to make a decision Monday or
early next week so let me know if you need anything from me. Have a good
weekend!

Matt

body:
JC! Monday still works for me. I’m excited to get started!

On Wed, Jun 22, 2022 at 12:44 PM JC Uva <jc@meetbigfoot.com> wrote:

> Matt -
>
> So great speaking to you earlier. As you said, there is so much alignment
> among us around values, philosophy and goals - this feels like a
> serendipitous match for both sides and we're super fired up to have you on
> board. As discussed, we are happy to have you start next Monday if that
> works for you.
>
> As I mentioned, we have our weekly team meetings on Mondays and Fridays
> but know next Monday is your daughter's birthday. Would you prefer to have
> a meet and greet on Tuesday instead? The Monday meeting is 1130am CT and
> we're happy to have a separate one for you on Tuesday if that's better for
> you and the fam. If the standard meeting window works for you, we're happy
> to keep it there as well.
>
> We want to be very conscious of not burning you out right away, so if you
> want to hold off until the following week, we understand. Know it will be
> hard to dive into coding and all on the road, but if you do start next
> week, we think it will be helpful for you to start getting up to speed so
> you can build momentum once you're settled in SLC.

subject: Re: Flipboard -Next Steps/ Zoom Interview Availability- Portfolio Review
body:
Hi Val and Pam!

Thank you both for all your support throughout this process. I am pretty
flexible this week and I am available tomorrow afternoon and Thursday and
Friday morning. I wanted to give you and the hiring team a heads up that I
have an offer I am considering which presses on our timing. I really
enjoyed my time with Dan and Patrick and was hoping to meet more of the
team, but I don’t want to waste anyone’s time if I’m not the front runner
for the position and we are still a ways out from the team reaching a
decision.

Please share this with your team and let me know how you want to move
forward.

Thank you for your time and consideration thus far!

Cheers,
Matt

Yes, my only meeting is 12–1pm CST so any other time 9–5pm CST works for me.

>

>
> Thanks and talk soon.
>
> JC
>
> Sent from my iPhone

subject: Re: Regarding your application to Gusto
body:
Hey Dayna,

Thanks for letting me know about the additional position. However, I have
accepted that other offer, and I don't want to waste your time. Perhaps the
stars will align in the future.

Thank you for your time and consideration!

Cheers,
Matt

On Fri, Jun 17, 2022 at 3:24 PM Dayna Ciarfalia <dayna.ciarfalia@gusto.com>
wrote:

> Hey Matt,
>
> Thanks for your time yesterday! Did want to let you know that the hiring
> manager for one of our other roles is interested in moving forward with an
> interview if you're interested.
>
> It's a Sr IC/PE role on our App Ecosystem team.
>
> I know you have another offer so understand if it's not the right time.
>
> Either way, let me know when you can!

subject: Re: Calendly Update
body:
Thanks for the update! Glad to have met you, and all the best to your team.

Cheers,
Matt

On Mon, Jun 20, 2022 at 3:30 PM Rebecca Scherff <r.scherff@calendly.com>
wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> Thank you for speaking with me about the Senior Product Design Manager
> role at Calendly. I appreciated the chance to learn more about you and your
> professional experience. After reviewing your qualifications with the
> hiring team they have decided to move forward with other candidates that

> and reach out to you if another opportunity opens that matches your skill
> set.
>
> Sincerely,
>
> Rebecca Scherff

subject: Re: Offer for Full Time Employment at Bigfoot

body:
Hey JC!

Thanks for the warm words! I’m excited to get to know you. Let’s definitely
connect next week.

Cheers,
Matt

>
> Obviously we haven't gotten the chance to connect yet and I would be happy
> to chat next week to answer any other questions you might have and just to
> get to know each other a bit. Nothing urgent or crazy, so no stress.

> share my excitement.
>
> Have a great weekend!
>

>

subject: Recruiting Call
body:
Hi Lucky,

I apologize for not accepting the calendar invite to confirm our call this
morning. I received an offer from another company at the end of the day
yesterday that I will be moving forward with. Thank you for your
consideration and for your time.

Best,
Matthew Born

subject: Re: Offer for Full Time Employment at Bigfoot
body:
This is great, thank you!

On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 5:59 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com> wrote:

> Absolutely, just ask that you please not share the below with anyone.
> Hopefully it will give you a deeper sense of all the great backers we have
> and opportunity ahead of us.
>
> Here's the last full investor deck
> <https://docsend.com/view/te48sq6sgbtna4ev> from Q1 (just add this email
> to access).
>
> Below is our list of investors -- not fully comprehensive as there are
> some other senior investors. This is what we typically share with new
> employees if they want to meet with a couple in particular.
>
>    - The founder of a leading, late-stage APAC VC (Soo Boon Koh
>    <https://www.linkedin.com/in/soo-boon-koh-14110b> of iGlobe - great
