> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 2:05 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>
>> Hey, in the meantime, could you share those investor decks?
>>
>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 1:20 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>
>>> Alex!
>>>
>>> Thank you so much for going to bat for me. It’s been a pleasure getting
>>> to know you and Shane, and learning more about the vision, so I am excited
>>> about this offer!
>>>
>>> *Give me 24 hours to share this update with my inner circle before
>>> making a decision.* I also have follow up interviews already scheduled
>>> with a handful of other companies tomorrow and next week, so I’ll need to
>>> figure out what I’m going to do about that as well. :)
>>>
>>> Feeling great about the future!
>>>
>>> Cheers,
>>> Matt
>>>
>>> On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 12:56 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Matt -
>>>> It was really great connecting with you on Tuesday. I'm adding our
>>>> cofounders - Shane and JC - as we're really excited to be able to make you
>>>> a formal offer to join us in building out the future of Bigfoot!
>>>>
>>>> We've been working on the best offer that we can pull together, at
>>>> least for the next 9-12 months before we raise our Seed round. Given our
>>>> planned out budget from the first raise for 2022, it looks like we will be
>>>> able to carve out $160,000 as an initial annual salary.  We've also been
>>>> using a site called Option Impact by Morgan Stanley
>>>> <https://www.shareworks.com/product/option-impact/> to benchmark vs
>>>> other early stage tech companies.  And while according to that this salary
>>>> would be in the 75th percentile or higher for Seed-Stage, C-Level Product /
>>>> Design Officers... we do completely understand how this is lower than what
>>>> you have been seeing.
>>>>
>>>> However, we do think you are a perfect fit for who we're looking to
>>>> lead all of our product design, and build out this division well into the
>>>> future. So we want to make sure you know a few other things:
>>>>
>>>>    1. This doesn't account for equity. In addition to that initial
>>>>    salary, we also expect to be able to offer you equity currently worth 1.4%
>>>>    of the company. This will vest over 4 years - the same vesting schedule for
>>>>    all equity holding leaders.
>>>>    2. As we discussed, this will be meaningful equity. The strike
>>>>    price on these options will be very low since things are still so
>>>>    early on in fundraising. And with the team we have in place, the incredible
>>>>    investors already backing us, and the vision / opportunity that we're
>>>>    building towards, we believe we have something special with enormous
>>>>    upside. It is exactly why I am not taking any salary until our Seed round
>>>>    -- because I wanted more equity for long term value.
>>>>    3. We can also ensure in any employment agreement that, once we
>>>>    raise the Seed, we can seek to adjust your salary higher. We can use the
>>>>    same language that we included in our agreement with our Head of Marketing
>>>>    4. We provide competitive health insurance benefits in the U.S.
>>>>    through Gusto. We are also absolutely fine with you taking personal or
>>>>    family time off as needed, as long as it is reasonable and doesn't impact
>>>>    the overall quality of your work
>>>>
>>>> Please take some time to think through things, and we're always
>>>> reachable via phone / whatsapp / in person (until Sunday afternoon) to
>>>> answer any questions. And if you need anything else from us to make a
>>>> more thoughtful decision, happy to send you investor decks, the investor
>>>> update we sent about 6 weeks ago, or our investor list.
>>>>
>>>> Hope you are as excited as we are about this Leadership Role to help us
>>>> build and scale Bigfoot into everything we know it can be!
>>>>
>>>> Best,
>>>> Alex, JC, and Shane
>>>> --
>>>> *Alex Ward | **Co-Founder*
>>>>
>>>> US / Whatsapp: +1 202 9049585
>>>> EU: +34 627 297013
>>>> MeetBigfoot.com
>>>>
>>>

subject: Re: Offer for Full Time Employment at Bigfoot
body:
Alex!

Thank you so much for going to bat for me. It’s been a pleasure getting to
know you and Shane, and learning more about the vision, so I am excited
about this offer!

*Give me 24 hours to share this update with my inner circle before making a
decision.* I also have follow up interviews already scheduled with a
handful of other companies tomorrow and next week, so I’ll need to figure
out what I’m going to do about that as well. :)

Feeling great about the future!

Cheers,
Matt

On Thu, Jun 16, 2022 at 12:56 PM Alex Ward <alex@meetbigfoot.com> wrote:

> Matt -
> It was really great connecting with you on Tuesday. I'm adding our
> cofounders - Shane and JC - as we're really excited to be able to make you
> a formal offer to join us in building out the future of Bigfoot!
>
> We've been working on the best offer that we can pull together, at least
> for the next 9-12 months before we raise our Seed round. Given our planned
> out budget from the first raise for 2022, it looks like we will be able to
> carve out $160,000 as an initial annual salary.  We've also been
> using a site called Option Impact by Morgan Stanley
> <https://www.shareworks.com/product/option-impact/> to benchmark vs
> other early stage tech companies.  And while according to that this salary
> would be in the 75th percentile or higher for Seed-Stage, C-Level Product /
> Design Officers... we do completely understand how this is lower than what
> you have been seeing.
>
> However, we do think you are a perfect fit for who we're looking to lead
> all of our product design, and build out this division well into the
> future. So we want to make sure you know a few other things:
>
>    1. This doesn't account for equity. In addition to that initial
>    salary, we also expect to be able to offer you equity currently worth 1.4%
>    of the company. This will vest over 4 years - the same vesting schedule for
>    all equity holding leaders.
>    2. As we discussed, this will be meaningful equity. The strike price
>    on these options will be very low since things are still so early on
>    in fundraising. And with the team we have in place, the incredible
>    investors already backing us, and the vision / opportunity that we're
>    building towards, we believe we have something special with enormous
>    upside. It is exactly why I am not taking any salary until our Seed round
>    -- because I wanted more equity for long term value.
>    3. We can also ensure in any employment agreement that, once we raise
>    the Seed, we can seek to adjust your salary higher. We can use the same
>    language that we included in our agreement with our Head of Marketing
>    4. We provide competitive health insurance benefits in the U.S.
>    through Gusto. We are also absolutely fine with you taking personal or
>    family time off as needed, as long as it is reasonable and doesn't impact
>    the overall quality of your work
>
> Please take some time to think through things, and we're always reachable
> via phone / whatsapp / in person (until Sunday afternoon) to answer any
> questions. And if you need anything else from us to make a more thoughtful
> decision, happy to send you investor decks, the investor update we sent
> about 6 weeks ago, or our investor list.
>
> Hope you are as excited as we are about this Leadership Role to help us
> build and scale Bigfoot into everything we know it can be!
>
> Best,
> Alex, JC, and Shane
> --
> *Alex Ward | **Co-Founder*
>
> US / Whatsapp: +1 202 9049585
> EU: +34 627 297013
> MeetBigfoot.com
>

> Matt
>
>
>

body:
Thanks, Chris!

It was a pleasure to meet Lowell. Thank you for providing the specific
reason I was dismissed. I am grateful for your time and consideration.

Best of luck in finding the right candidate!

Cheers,
Matt

On Tue, Jun 14, 2022 at 1:26 PM Chris Shu <chris.shu@reddit.com> wrote:

> Hey Matt,
>
> I hope you're having a nice start to your week. Thanks for meeting with
> Lowell yesterday. He let me know that he enjoyed his conversation with you
> and learning more about your consulting and startup experience. Ultimately
> though, given the scope of the projects that we envision the Design Manager
> for our X team will tackle, we've decided to move forward with other design
> leaders who we felt have more experience coaching and mentoring a large
> design team.

> hope you won't mind if I reach out again in the future. I know Lowell

> I also want to thank you again for taking the time to meet with us, and
> hope you’ll keep Reddit in mind in the future as well.
>
> Sincerely,
> Chris

Matt

On Tue, Jun 7, 2022 at 5:11 PM Tatum Specht <tatum@joinhandshake.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> My name is Tatum, and I'm one of the Recruiting Experience Coordinators
> here at Handshake. Thank you for taking the time to speak with Amy - she
> enjoyed learning more about you, and we're excited to invite you to the
> next step in our hiring process!
>
> *Next Steps ➡️*
> The next step is a *Past Work Session* with one of our design teammates.
> This will be a 45-minute session over Zoom.
>
> During this session, we’d love to have you walk us through some of your
> most recent (or your most favorite) work while sharing about the project
> and your contributions. We'd also like to hear about the process and
> decision making behind your designs. This is meant to be a casual
> conversation, so there’s no need to prepare a presentation or anything
> formal - we’re happy to look through your portfolio, a case study, or
> project together with you. We welcome any form (whether website or slides
> or Figma files). There will also be plenty of time for you to ask
> questions, as well!
> *To help me schedule your past work exercise, would you please indicate at
> least 4 dates/times you're available using the link below my signature?* I
> will follow up via email with additional details after confirming your
> conversation.
>
> Let us know if you have any questions ahead of the session - we're excited
> to be moving to this next step!
>
> Many thanks,
> Tatum
>
> --
>
> Tatum Specht | Talent | Handshake
>
> Pronouns: she/her/hers

pleasure to meet someone who has helped me become a better designer. Here
are a couple quick video case studies I mentioned I would share yesterday:

permits. Either way, I hope to have a chance to meet more of the team soon.

Happy Thursday!
Matt

subject: Re: Howdy!
body:
Hey Kris!

It felt really special to connect with someone who has been on such a
similar journey. Thank you! Please excuse the presumption that you needed
immediate help due to your time off next month. I trust you’ve already
accounted for the implications of your absence. :) As for my offense, I am
happy to share as much detail as necessary. Here’s the short version:

My first job out of college was teaching Graphic Design at the high school
I graduated from. One of my students—who was and is a close friend of my
little sister—and I had what I thought was an inappropriate relationship. I
was lying to myself and the reality is I committed sexual assault since I
was 23 and she was 16. I disclosed this truth to the head of the school
which led to my immediate dismissal. Though the victim and her parents did
not want to press charges, the state was obligated to prosecute since I was
in a position of authority. I was formally charged in July 2010 and
accepted a plea in April 2011 to serve no jail time, register as a sex
offender, and attend 30 months of group therapy. I met all requirements of
my sentence and I have remained in good standing with local law enforcement
for over 10 years now.

There are many in my life now who were close to me then who would be
willing to share a character recommendation letter if necessary. Thank you
for taking the time to navigate this for me, Kris! Let me know if you need
anything else.

Talk soon,
Matt

subject: Re: 5 Things Startups Get Wrong About Growth
body:
Hey Mike - I just sent over an invite for 4/1 at 11:30a CST. Feel free to
move it around that day if that time doesn't work. Otherwise, I'll see you
then!

On Mon, Mar 7, 2022 at 3:01 PM Mike Rome <mike@moonwater.studio> wrote:

> Hey Matt, been forever since those GiveForward days.
>
> For sure, let's catch up. Any chance you have a slot Fri 4/1? I'm open any
> time other than 9:30-10:30a central.
>
> Just a bit tied up this month between a handful of engagements and a
> vacation end of month.
>
> *As promised, here’s 5 Things Startups Get Wrong About Growth.*
>
>
>
> *1. Focusing on output over input metrics.*
>
> Improving MAUs
> <https://medium.com/swlh/diligence-at-social-capital-part-1-accounting-for-user-growth-4a8a449fddfc>
>  or MRR
> <https://medium.com/@jonathanhsu/diligence-at-social-capital-part-2-accounting-for-revenue-growth-551fa07dd972> require
> constant review of their inputs. Impressive topline growth can mask deeper
> issues. Are you ready to spend more on acquisition? Should you pump the
> brakes and improve retention? Are you thinking enough about reactivating
> customers or expanding revenue? Growth Accounting and Quick Ratios (linked
> above) will tell you.
>
>
>
> *2. Conflating a successful marketing channel with how you grow.*
>
> When I ask companies how they grow, I usually hear about their most
> successful marketing channel. By all means, double down on channels seeing
> strong scale and unit-economics, but also know that it’s a shortsighted
> view on growth. What’s your Racecar Framework for Growth
> <https://www.reforge.com/blog/racecar-growth-framework>, and do your
> cross-functional priorities reflect each component’s potential?
>
>
>
> *3. Not staying current on frameworks for growth.*
>
> Tactics for growth are similar to channels—over time they saturate. Startup
> Metrics for Pirates
> <https://www.slideshare.net/dmc500hats/startup-metrics-for-pirates-long-version> was
> a breakthrough for helping teams prioritize and focus on growth, but it’s
> also fifteen years old. I still use AARRR, but I also use newer frameworks
> like Growth Loops
> <https://www.growth-catalyst.in/p/growth-loops-and-where-to-find-them?s=r>.
> For many companies, Loops are a smarter way to grow.
>
>
>
> *4. Going “all-in” on Product-Led Growth (PLG).*
>
> Going from Marketing-Led or Sales-Led to Product-Led Growth takes time. If
> you’re not careful with how it’s communicated, it can create a culture that
> implies “growth is one team’s job.” This isn’t healthy. It can lead to
> missing go-to-market opportunities. Be careful about putting too much
> pressure on one team, or unintentionally discounting the important work
> non-Product teams are doing for growth.
>
>
>
> *5. Iterating on Referral too Early.*
>
> The way you nail Referral is to nail the points in the customer journey
> that come before it
> <https://www.productled.org/foundations/the-product-led-growth-flywheel>.
> Too often companies think Referral is as easy as integrating with a
> Referral partner or slapping a few buttons across an application. This
> rarely works because Referral is earned and timing matters.
>
>
> Thanks!
>
> --
>
>
> *Mike Rome*
>
> Fractional CMO & CGO, Startup Advisor
>
> https://moonwater.studio/
>

subject: Re: Your Toptal application
body:
Thank you for your time and for the additional details, Arpie!

On Wed, Feb 16, 2022 at 8:02 AM Arpie Mikayelyan <
arpie.mikayelyan@toptal.com> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> Thanks for your email and interest in Toptal. I am happy to provide more
> details about what exactly we expected to see in your portfolio in order to
> proceed with your application.
>
> First, I would like to mention that our process is dedicated to evaluating
> 3 main directions: your professional skill set, the quality of your work,
> and the way/structure you present your works.
>
> As I have mentioned previously we are interested in seeing a “thorough
> process” in your portfolio. This means presenting the main steps you
> generally implement before the final results. (Research, UX, and UI
> stages.) It is recommended to introduce what was the main problem of the
> project/product and how you came to the final solution, and what was your
> main investment in the final outcome.
>
> Additionally, I have mentioned the “high level of complexity”. This refers
> to the project type, your specialization as well as your visualization
> skills. We are interested in candidates who have solid experience in
> creating modern and fresh solutions for web and mobile applications,
> website designs, and product designs from diverse industries having complex
> problems.
>
> Moreover, when we are analyzing portfolios we need to make sure that the
> body of work will be able to compete well within the platform, compared to
> the portfolios and talent profiles we currently have on Toptal. With that
> said, it is not only about the work and how detailed it is, but also how
> well it is presented both in terms of visual and process. Ultimately, that
> is what drives our decision-making process when evaluating portfolios.
>
>
> I believe I have covered all your concerns and you will have enough time
> for further revisions.
>
> Hope to see you back at Toptal soon.
> Feel free to let me know in case of additional questions and concerns.
>
> Best Regards
> Arpie M.
>
> Arpie Mikayelyan
> Senior Product Designer | Designer Screener
> +374 96 976577

>

subject: Re: Your Toptal application
body:
Hi, Arpie!

Thank you for your message. This is really surprising since “the thorough
process implemented and the high level of complexity” is a hallmark of all
of my work and I have been recognized countless times for this. I suppose I
should have spent more time to show more process. Do you have anyone you
could refer me to to learn more about Toptal’s vetting process?

Thanks!
Matt

I run a product design consultancy that contracts with growth stage tech
companies like the one you are describing. We specialize in designing
highly technical web applications for non-technical users. Would be happy
to discuss a contract arrangement if that works for your client. :)

Thanks for reaching out,
Matt

subject: Inquiry for Matthew Born
body:
Hi Debra,

This is Megan Born, writing to ask a couple questions regarding Matt's
conviction. You represented him in 2010/2011. It looks like you are now a
Judge - Congratulations!

We relocated to Utah a few years ago and have three little girls of our
own. We have been fortunate to not have felt restricted by too many things
with Matt's conviction / RSO status. With our oldest being in public school
for the first time this fall, we are starting to see some complications.
For example, there is a "Dads and Donuts" event and a Parent-Teacher
Conference this week. Instead of trying to be sneaky, Matt reached out to
the Principle to introduce himself and see about getting permission to be
on grounds with our daughter for special events. He was very kind and went
further up into the district to see what exceptions could be made. The DA
sent over the textbook law for RSO on school grounds and said it's not
permitted. He did suggest Matt could try to get a court approved permission
for this sort of thing.

A few questions we are wondering:

-What type of lawyer would we hire to represent us for something like this?
Assuming it would need to be done in a Utah court?

-We have talked for years about attempting to have his conviction sealed,
now that he's been in good standing for more than 10 years. Any suggestions
on who we could work with to go about that?

I appreciate any input you can offer. Feel free to call us if that's easier
for you!

Matthew and Megan Born
(309) 657-3798

body:
Thanks for your update on this, Mike! Will review this tomorrow morning,
and connect with you at the end of the day tomorrow.

On Tue, Jun 8, 2021 at 5:27 PM Mike McNamara <mmcnamara@artemishealth.com>
wrote:

> Evening,
>
> Quick update on my progress: I'm continuing to work on generating
> contingency tables for the items listed in the program stories sheet. I had
> started to calculate these manually but quickly realized that isn't a
> sustainable approach and would cause headaches in subsequent runs. In
> coding out a repeatable solution I identified another issue where an eagle
> eyed viewer may notice inconsistencies in population counts for care gaps
> (for example, when we look at month 12 after enrollment). In short, not all
> members may have a claim on month 12 so we don't have gic reported for that
> month and it will look like our counts are off. While this is expected
> given my approach, it could be confusing and cause a loss of confidence in
> the results. I'm working to pull the next most recent reported gic, and
> once I have that I can continue on calculating the contingency tables
> across groups.
>
> I expect to have this worked out by EOD tomorrow and will notify when the
> excel is updated accordingly, let me know if there are any questions or
> concerns, thanks!
>
> -Mike
>
> On Mon, Jun 7, 2021 at 12:01 PM Mike McNamara <mmcnamara@artemishealth.com>
> wrote:
>
>> Updated program dashboard (v1.1) attached, but as mentioned, I'll work on
>> updating the excel with the exact numbers. Let me know if you have any
>> questions, thanks!
>>
>> -Mike
>>
>> --
>>
>> Michael McNamara
>> Data Scientist
>> ArtemisHealth.com <http://www.artemishealth.com/> | *Trends with
>> benefits.*
>>
>>

subject: Re: Design Coordination One-off
body:
Happy Friday!

Just wanted to confirm we weren’t planning to meet today. As always, our
latest work will be in the design repo and we are still trying to figure
out the best way to approach merging past ideas into this new “main branch”
prototype. Feel free to share any notes on what you’d like to make sure we
include next week.

Enjoy your weekend and thank you for your business!
Matt

subject: Re: Updated invitation: Program Dash check in #2 @ Weekly from 8:30am to 9am on Thursday (MDT) (Matt Born)
body:
Hi, Tom!

Sorry for not sharing an update by the afternoon like I said I would. I was
offline for most of my Figma work yesterday so I just synced where I’m at.
What I learned diving into the details is that Mike’s report has maybe 20%
relevance with the Program Stories spreadsheet and maybe half of that in
terms of usable values. I’m not sure the best way to formalize a request
for usable values since the spreadsheet, this report, and the design
patterns we’ve been discussing seem to have very different goals. I still
think I can finish a testable draft of the prototype today, but I’ll need
to meet with you to figure out a way to get usable, relevant data.

Do you have any time to meet today or are you off?

subject: Reflection & Gratitude
body:
Happy Monday, Kurt! 👋🏼

Thank you for your time on Friday. Sometimes deep conversations late in the
week can be extra taxing, yet I felt uniquely refreshed by your energy and
optimism around how holistic experience design can help mature your
business.

You asked for portfolio examples, so here’s a case study from my last
in-house role at Artemis Health.
<https://mattborn.com/work/for/artemis/> Interestingly
enough, Artemis is one of our active clients. Just met with their head of
product this morning. Since Moona is a new business, we haven’t published
any case studies, yet. I’d be happy to walk you through a recent project
over Zoom to show you how we use daily design sprints to convert empirical
user research into design patterns and testable prototypes.

If you are still interested in getting a jump on that June 14 start date, I
am open to contracting some hours directly in the meantime if it’s easier
to get that rolling while we work out the details of a long-term playbook
that involves my team.

I am extremely grateful to know such passionate and driven product leaders

<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=dd47000713c58a2c56e80dbfc4955ed50bc1293c2dc6dd2c31c371d3820f5ef5390594d503387f0a400165d43efa3da945e875b19948ea0ff80b75fcd6511abbe66d99dc9e98412b>.
Basic Cardmembers with a Gold, Platinum, or Reserve Delta SkyMiles Credit
Card from American Express are eligible for the first bag fee waiver. More
details on the program can be found at delta.com/firstbagfree
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=dd47000713c58a2c1ec5e61be2a23b1b673ec81f8f55dc3f6d0de85e994d18b84a71fa7ed3797cc350e514cb3d354c88f685dfd092aa6e2c52f6a6b6cdd798a8716070accc663ef5>

A standard checked bag with Delta may be up to 50 lbs and 62 linear inches
(per piece). Additional fees apply for oversize, overweight, and/or
additional pieces of checked baggage. Please review Delta's baggage
guidelines for details. Weight and size restrictions may vary when checking
baggage on carriers other than Delta. Contact with the operating carrier
for detailed checked baggage allowances. You must be checked in at the gate
by the applicable check-in deadlines or your reservation may be cancelled.
Please review Delta's check-in requirement guidelines for details. Check-in
requirements vary by airline, so if your ticket includes travel on other
airlines, please check with the operating carrier on your ticket.

Do you have comments about our service? Please email
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=dd47000713c58a2c1193845b46356c905348e13943ed895b380fd4c82ed6405762195257e36b4e4d51b2d2c120c11621d123e846ccff2f1aee0035ad51788522>us
to share them.

*ADVICE TO INTERNATIONAL PASSENGERS ON LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY*

Passengers embarking upon a journey involving an ultimate destination or a
stop in a country other than the country of departure are advised that the
provisions of an international treaty (the Warsaw Convention, the 1999
Montreal Convention, or other treaty), as well as a carrier’s own contract
of carriage or tariff provisions, may be applicable to their entire
journey, including any portion entirely within the countries of departure
and destination. The applicable treaty governs and may limit the liability
of carriers to passengers for death or personal injury, destruction or loss
of, or damage to, baggage, and for delay of passengers and baggage.

Additional protection can usually be obtained by purchasing insurance from
a private company. Such insurance is not affected by any limitation of the
carrier’s liability under an international treaty. For further information
please consult your airline or insurance company representative.

*Conditions of Carriage*

Air transportation on Delta and the Delta Connection® carriers is subject
to Delta's conditions of carriage
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=dd47000713c58a2c77e5c03f276b4c5faa650dbc91117bd0f6f25df62eb23a423cb5925de960e81c439dc102b68aaaafb22475e5076433167125e98aad81fc90>.
They include terms governing for example:

• Limits on our liability
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=dd47000713c58a2cd68b74696aaa415de7d21aea5185918cd702d7e4bf840627344364af14553e3f6ced8aa06a9197f538857120b144c04aef97cc3dbf588f63b196245e54f7115c>
for personal injury or death of passengers, and for loss, damage of delay
of goods and baggage.
• Claim restrictions
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=dd47000713c58a2cc783dac292aa5dacf5aa2d187ad52884f88cacfde7d3de2428648dc468637d94be34756069ab6fd76a12c4c2787ca6a54a4ce8dec24d23c3cf9efe58c0993e95>
including time periods within which you must file a claim or bring action
against us.
• Our right to change terms
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b36644bb0d8176e25a15cf92e63cb457accab9794441b9d5cb67e45f2012f0ffe5b3485624150b50a6b0dfa055231752a9e10b541a2671d13342dea569886756e18f7>
of the contract.
• Check-in requirements
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b36642a8c7524083dc8d5fb614310464f830d7d40701cc03ab1cc98ecba0d806cd324c5dc669c1ee992751a977d9fae482144ba0a4912b194722874d8e8b49a71213b>
and other rules established when we may refuse carriage
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b3664a9d98c786ecd3e322f7ecb2268380ca762052a6dcfd9ef9be3d85f0ad59f388bdf93ebaac27c3355d428a2ac3bc9ae4a9105201681a28d339a215722397984ef>
.
• Our rights and limits of our liability for delay or failure to perform
service
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b3664e00c7d7b3b4a9d18cddb596986f4b76937b489fe10c51bf33e3730d077d3bad101047720bcd248aefe44111c37127175e00445dc5203b995d09a4d05c440563e>
including schedule change, substitution of alternative air carriers or
aircraft, and rerouting.
• Our policy on overbooking flights
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b36641f12f2e1c933c62507865553c1a2ef564fd76059c42927657121fb601f993c2aafd8a8def0acd8072d37176de78268b84696cf02217e5a2fec0da6e7e98954b5>,
and your rights if we deny you boarding due to an oversold flight.

These terms are incorporated by reference into our contract with you. You
may view these conditions of carriage on delta.com, or by requesting a copy
from Delta.

You have received this email because you elected to receive your Electronic
Ticket receipt sent to you via email. If you would like to take advantage
of other Delta email programs featuring special fares, promotions,
information and flight updates, please visit: delta.com/emailprograms
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b36643ffbe08d11281fdde0de486562cd82ffa87dd91ee824cf30f6ebbf5050764a0da51c378fda8e033b2071ee45cdecc728a899751a8f4c2ac907ea830bc3910308>
or delta.com/notifications
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b36640872ace04eb4849adfc52c5950abb6c776855c3a5c65693fee40553f74e6290bdeba65545d8e694f42a064cc752a2d08f27ac5d99c4b502dcf22c86e637798cd>

This document establishes the creation of your electronic EMD(S) in our
computer systems. It does not constitute a document of carriage. Where this
document is issued for transportation or services other than passenger air
transportation, specific terms and conditions may apply. These terms and
conditions may be provided separately or may be obtained from the issuing
agent.

Effective December 15, 2019, the Canada Air Passenger Protection
Regulations may provide additional protections to passengers traveling to
or from Canada:



*If you are denied boarding, your flight is cancelled or delayed for at
least two hours, or your baggage is lost or damaged, you may be entitled to
certain standards of treatment and compensation under the Air Passenger
Protection Regulations. For more information about your passenger rights
please contact your air carrier (www.delta.com/appr
<https://click.t.delta.com/u/?qs=9c01a5d7a29b36644eb237ba55654c665f41cd01472978e70dde8e6411b8fbde223510304140b38ffc4aa44549b20f6bc8349084f2f5c6ed8c6b2d2acbf887f1aee0a3f092ccfce5>)
or visit the Canadian Transportation Agency’s website. Si l’embarquement
vous est refusé, ou si votre vol est annulé ou retardé d’au moins deux

ou visiter le site Web de l’Office des transports du Canada.*

subject: Re: Quick Follow-up
body:
That chart is accurate. I decided to stick with the flat hourly rate of
$150/hr. to keep things simple which includes my production designer.
Market rate for dedicated principal design is $225/hr., but since we are
starting with heavy UI and holding on any deeper UX work, I wanted to
evaluate this model first.

Thank you for being so pointed. I’ll be sure to include my own chart like
this on future proposals. :)

subject: Re: Hi! 👋🏼
body:
Tanya!

Thank you so much for your time even though you are swamped!

I am so grateful for all of your tips, wisdom, and encouragement to do my
own thing. We need more people like you in the world. I feel bad that I’m
not sure how to make this more of a mutual value exchange so please let me
know if there’s a way for me to help you. I don’t want to oversell my
capacity and become more of a liability than a resource for you, but once
me and my designer get a sense for our weekly capacity, I’ll let you know
if we have hours available to help you with some of your UX project needs.
I like how I think you said it, “not just design, but doing the thinking
for our clients.” So good.

Happy Thursday!

Matt

body:
Thank you! It is getting harder to maintain a portfolio when all my product
work is protected by NDAs and non-competes. Here is the case study
<https://mattborn.com/work/for/artemis/> I showed when interviewing at
Chargeback. I typically only show additional work by request based on what
type of work is needed. The advice I am looking for is more about account
management in the agency context.

When is a good time to chat?

subject: Hi! 👋🏼
body:
Tanya!

Hey, I’ve been talking to Jeremy a little bit about a surge in requests for
proposals I’ve had lately to provide “contract product design services.”
I’m curious if we could chat over Zoom so I could get your advice and learn
a little bit about why you are hiring a UX person at Thoughtlab. Maybe
there’s an opportunity to partner here? Totes unrelated to our rebrand
project at Chargeback, and to be clear, I have no intent of separating from
Chargeback any time soon. 😉

Thanks!

Matt

entertained. I hope you are all safe and well. We talk about our Sprout
family often. :)

Cheers!
Matt Born

> last chatted and the world certainly is a bit of a crazier place these days.
>
> So, your financial advisor is correct that withholdings of the required
> employee taxes is most commonly done by withholding stock at the settlement
> of the shares.  This was an oversight on our end and when we were getting
> ready to prepare 2020 year end payroll tax forms at the end of the year, we
> realized this oversight, but wanted to make sure we remitted these amounts
> properly on the employees behalf to ensure they got the proper W2 tax form
> for the year vs a 1099 (as was previously communicated).  We can definitely
> set up time to discuss this further with him if he has additional
> questions, but this is the most concise summary of how this occurred.
>
> Let us know if there are any other questions or if you would like to set
> up some time to chat about it- thanks!
>

Wow, what timing! Thank you for taking the time to put this together! I
just sent you another email, so hopefully it made it to your inbox.

kristen@velvetandashe.com> wrote:

>

>

> to let me know how many hours you would like to purchase and the contract
> length - whether it be weekly, month to month or six months.  From there we

subject: Thank you!
body:
Hi Kristen!

Hope you had a great weekend! I really enjoyed chatting with you on Friday.
So much so that I spent a good chunk of my date night dinner with my wife
telling her about our conversation and my strong feeling that we should
give it a shot. She was initially hesitant yet fully supportive and told me
to go for it.

This morning, she sent me a message asking me to compile the list I would
be sending to you and that she would find childcare to help me take care of
those things. This was completely unexpected, and I felt I should reach out
and let you know before you spent more time on our account.

Again, I really valued the time you were willing to spare to educate me on
how it works and your business model. My wife and I are going to try
something new, and if it doesn’t work out you will be our first call. And
in the deepest sense, I owe you more than my gratitude. Maybe we’ll find a
way to support each other in the future?

Thank you!

Matt

subject: Re: Important Tax Information: Follow up - Sprout Social equity compensation
body:
Hey Sprout! Thanks for the reminder. I sent this information to our
financial advisor and he mentioned that company's withholding taxes for
their employees is pretty common but usually it's done with stock
withholding. He wanted me to ask what triggered this?

Of course will get it paid but just wanted to clarify for him.

Cheers,
Matt

subject: Fwd: Action Required: Sprout Social equity compensation
body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sprout Equity <equity@sproutsocial.com>
Date: Wed, Dec 23, 2020 at 2:26 PM
Subject: Action Required: Sprout Social equity compensation
To: <me@mattborn.com>


Hi Matthew,

As a follow up to Sprout Social’s communications sent earlier in 2020, we
wanted to provide additional information on your equity compensation from
2020 and your required tax obligation.  Sprout will be issuing each equity
holder a W-2 tax form for their equity compensation received in January of
2020; therefore, Sprout will be remitting your required local and federal
tax liability on your behalf.  What does this mean for you?

You will be receiving a W-2 tax form for the 2020 tax year by January 31,
2021 which will report your total equity compensation amount, as well as
local and federal tax amounts remitted on your behalf from Sprout:

   -

   US Federal Income Tax Withholding: $5,700.90
   -

   State Income Tax Withholding: $1,282.70
   -

   Other State tax, if applicable (SUI/SDI/PFML): $0.00
   -

   Social Security Withholding: $1,606.62
   -

   Medicare Withholding: $375.74
   -

   Total tax due: $8,965.95


Since we are remitting taxes on your behalf, you will need to arrange
repayment of your required tax liability to Sprout Social by January 31,
2021 and have attached payment instructions on how to do so.

Instructions on how and where to remit payment by check, wire or ACH are
listed below.

Please reach out to Equity@sproutsocial.com with any questions.

Regards,

Sprout Equity team

If you are sending an electronic payment (wire or ACH), please use the
following bank information:

Account Name:       SPROUT SOCIAL, INC.

131 S DEARBORN ST SUITE 700

CHICAGO IL 60603

Account Number:   3302297531

Routing Number:    121-140-399

Swift Code:              SVBKUS6S





If you are sending a check, please send to Sprout Social’s lockbox at the
following remittance address:



Sprout Social, Inc.

Dept. CH 17275

Palatine, IL 60055-7575 USA

body:
Oh, and please allow me to blast your inbox twice because I have wonderful
news: I finished dealing with all the spiders in my crawlspace installing a
new network in my office with ethernet and so far my Zoom calls have been
flawless. Thank you all for your patience and assistance while I was
experiencing connection issues.

Matt

subject: 👋🏼 Thank you!
to: Scott Schlegel <schlegel@chargeback.com>, brennick.langston@chargeback.com, david.adams@chargeback.com, george.south@chargeback.com, jeff.reese@chargeback.com, jeremy.banks@chargeback.com
body:
Good morning!

Thanks again for your time on Friday. I really enjoyed our conversation and
appreciated the hard-hitting questions. I left feeling inspired and started
working on a playbook for “how to amplify the voice of the customer” since
that was a common thread in our conversations. Thanks for your
consideration and hopefully we’ll chat again soon.

Happy Monday! 👍🏼

Matt

subject: Re: [#25375109] Lost Google voice feature and number    [ ref:_00D00VNwG._5005w1dYUwD,00D5GEAW.5005wDAAW:ref ]
body:
Ok. I don’t see any of those options. I just created a new personal
account and got a new number. Thanks!

On Tue, Oct 6, 2020 at 2:08 PM Google Workspace Support <esupport@google.com>
wrote:

> Hello Matt,
>
> Thank you for the quick response. You do not need to upgrade or switch
> your current G Suite Subscription. You can try to re-login on your Admin
> Console (https://admin.google.com/) on an incognito window for chrome
> and  > Go to Apps > G Suite > Add services once again > And choose the
> Edition you want for Google Voice (Starter, Standard, Premier).
>
>
> Sincerely,
>
> Andrei
> Google Workspace Support
>
> -------------------------
>
> Case: #25375109
> Subject: Lost Google voice feature and number
>
> Chat Started: Tue, 6 Oct 2020 12:30:27 -0700
> Chat Subject: Lost Google voice feature and number
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Thank you for contacting Google
> Workspace Support. My name is Andrei and I'll be working with you today.
> While I read over your message, is there anything else you'd like to add?
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Hello Matt! How are you today?
>
>  Matt Born: Hi, Andrei! Yeah, I tried to resolve this a couple weeks ago
> but had to step out so never finished.
>
>  Matt Born: I’m good thanks.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: That is great to hear. Do you still
> have the case number with you regarding the issue?
>
>  Matt Born: Lemme look…
>
>  Matt Born: Case #25204590
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Thank you! By the way, for any reason
> that we're unable to complete the troubleshooting on this chat due to
> connectivity issues, I'll send you the complete steps via email. Can I have
> your preferred email address?
>
>  Matt Born: me@mattborn.com
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Thank you! May I have a 2-3 minutes to
> check on this for you please?
>
>  Matt Born: Yes.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Thank you! So basically there was no
> troubleshooting made on the case number you gave. To ensure that we resolve
> your issue quickly, I will be asking a few questions. Is that okay?
>
>  Matt Born: Yes.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Thank you! May I know if you have other
> G Suite accounts other than mattborn.com?
>
>  Matt Born: Hmm, do you mean do I have access to others?
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Yes. If there are Domains that has
> their own G Suite accounts.
>
>  Matt Born: My wife has a G Suite account that I access sometimes, but
> it’s in her name.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Because upon checking here on your
> account under mattborn.com. There is no Google Voice subscription
> included on your account.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: No history for the Domain.
>
>  Matt Born: Interesting. I’ve been using Google Voice for years under that
> account.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: So most likely the Google Voice might
> be purchased under a different account or your personal Gmail account.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Was your Google Voice for free?
>
>  Matt Born: Not sure. I pay a monthly fee for G Suite.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Not for G Suite.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: For Google Voice (that has your number)
>
>  Matt Born: I received an email on Sep 14 to me@mattborn.com saying my
> Google Voice number expired.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Would it be okay if you could take a
> screen shot of the content?
>
>  Matt Born: I haven’t paid a separate fee for Google Voice.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: And upload it here on our chat window?
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: But were you paying for your number
> (google voice) before?
>
>  Matt Born: Customer attached
> Your_Google_Voice_number__773__980-9213_has_expired__-_me_mattborn_com_-_Matt_Born_Mail.png:
>
> https://storage.googleapis.com/esp-prod.appspot.com/12626374024?Signature=mQ9Hi/eCXnIhxAeysfnoWXnJl8FWghXsHF4HC8JAouGTviXz0GmsXEbMHg8aZFXl1czSrcvkQ1yVThFWFx%2BmvqRVU6vAzfSQDQFMKnlE/9Vqulh4NPU7vDfxjGq4iEdl/sodqnEgvJnATsmvH3Dlsn3GCizraHqss347INFPd6tESXjFwxZ5WWu7OOqP4JQcl%2B9W/VUi2lN94H35BB7lVfNJBf97sdsybIe2ulLOxHD1pGb9AZ/p/g6WlDVvk7xlF03hteRVHZKlDUpB1GA4O585Ka1/w75LO85KO8p5cpe3dVMOJubP%2BKcgTl6Nx8IL%2BngeckKpDo%2Buv0jcOtp0kA%3D%3D&GoogleAccessId=gts-hoolichat-ui@system.gserviceaccount.com&Expires=1602099975
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Because Google Voice is an additional
> subscription on-top of your G Suite service where; we charge our customers
> per user license/month. The charges varies between $10, $20, and $30
> depending on the Google Voice edition as described from our support
> document - https://support.google.com/a/answer/9229433
>
>  Matt Born: How come I never had to pay in the past?
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Most likely your Google Voice was a
> legacy account on which we do not offer anymore, Matt. And it is separate
> with G Suite. Which is why there is no history here on your account.
>
>  Matt Born: Also, I was under the impression “as long as you use it to
> communicate between your Google Voice number and other U.S. numbers, it’s
> totally free to place calls and send text messages.” Is that no longer true?
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: It no longer works that way since
> Google Voice on G Suite is now a paid service.
>
>  Matt Born: The first sentence under Set up Voice in the Google Voice Help
> Center says “With Google Voice, you get a free phone number for calls, text
> messages, and voicemail.”
>
>  Matt Born: Do I just need to sign up for Google Voice on a Google account
> that isn’t under my G Suite domain?
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: If you paid for the service then you
> will also get the features included with it. No need. You can sign up for
> Google Voice using your account.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: By going to your Admin Console > Apps >
> G Suite
>
>  Matt Born: Google Voice isn’t worth $10/mo. to me.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Then click on 'Add services'
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: I completely understand, Matt. What is
> your decision?
>
>  Matt Born: I just performed the steps you suggested. On the Google Voice
> page it says “You're getting the best out of Google. We will notify you
> when new subscriptions become available.”
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: You can actually subscribe right now
> through your Admin Console if you want to have it implemented to your
> domain.
>
>  Matt Born: Can you show me where?
>
>  Matt Born: Customer attached get-more-services-google-voice.png:
> https://storage.googleapis.com/esp-prod.appspot.com/12638074027?Signature=woSphrp9QKxUxK6vZ0d1oTf32DFGevJw40W9uXWl8fkBuusdSxVNG6f89oxd7GGDRJC4qsBCuQuXe%2ByVrjBdvWx1hiErxbG6g26AmAXV35Slg1O%2B6OW6gvkndrgfXQ2WZGitYT/UXxf7xp4YskgQ/RgRlTU2bgOKDULzj/uZSj2j75kBtbdZaX/y3C0u3NHF2urSN9eAcsQkNRpcod6%2BiG9bwozAW5fTlk6sGNfsBj9bK4%2B7tWwFys5DbEMaq4huaC/Z1lmDdr7DA9CSEW2ItXGTlXS2LX7NfYZovXzgqgiUnlXpe7cdml8POfVNACnLQR96Xsuo4ARz9eArJKQcNg%3D%3D&GoogleAccessId=gts-hoolichat-ui@system.gserviceaccount.com&Expires=1602100529
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Sure thing.On your Admin Console home
> page. Go to apps > then click on G Suite
>
>  Matt Born: Done.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Can you now click on 'Add services'?
>
>  Matt Born: Done.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Once your on that page you should be
> able to see the editions of Google Voice.
>
>  Matt Born: Yes.
>
>  Google Workspace Support, Andrei: Once you have subscribed to Google
> Voice. You can then follow the steps as outlined on this other support link
> - https://support.google.com/a/answer/9039020
>
> +++
> ref:_00D00VNwG._5005w1dYUwD,00D5GEAW.5005wDAAW:ref
>

subject: Re: Clearwater Design — Day 2
body:
I dig the yellow. Thanks for sharing! Let’s rework the text underlines to
achieve more contrast since the yellow-on-yellow makes it harder to read.
See:
https://medium.com/ux-power-tools/tiny-trend-7-chunky-overlapping-underlines-882b7705222f

On Fri, Jul 17, 2020 at 6:15 PM Daylen Stoutin
<daylen@clearwaterdata.solutions> wrote:

> Matt,
>
> I should have phrased it as “my first alternative attempt” is yellow as
> I’m far from wedded to it. As you know, I’m lost with colors.
>
> Daylen E. Stoutin
> Cell: 205-614-2143
>
> On Jul 17, 2020, at 6:10 PM, Daylen Stoutin
> <daylen@clearwaterdata.solutions> wrote:
>
> ﻿
> Matt,
>
> Thanks for all of this!  Super helpful.
>
> I built out the first iteration of the site in Wix and after working with
> the colors for a few hours I think I want to pivot away from the Salmon.  I
> love the look but two things make me reconsider.  Kasey's first reaction
> was that it was too feminine.  After thinking about it a while, I think I'd
> buy an $8/month subscription service from the site we built - not sure I'd
> drop $10K - $100K on mission-critical services (which is what we're doing).
>
> Kasey and I came up with yellow (#FFD747) - which I realize is near what
> we moved away from to start.
>
> <image.png>
>
>
> Two reasons I bring this up:
>
>    1. Any initial thoughts?  Should I try another tack as well?  A darker
>    salmon/red?  Is there a specific reason you'd avoid gold/yellow?
>    2. I wanted to let you know before you went and put time into the
>    logo, in case you decided to explore introducing the accent color directly
>    into it.
>
> Thanks again,
> Daylen
>
>
>
> On Fri, Jul 17, 2020 at 3:46 PM Megan B <us@mattmeg.com> wrote:
>
>> Forgot something important. Illustration!
>>
>> —
>>
>> *Why are illustrations important?*
>>
>> To a brand, a marketing site, and each individual message you are trying
>> to convey? Clarity.
>>
>> See this article:
>> https://www.imaginarycloud.com/blog/illustration-matters/
>>
>> —
>>
>> *Where can I look for spot illustrations?*
>>
>> Here’s a start: https://freeillustrations.xyz
>>
>> —
>>
>> *What about animation?*
>>
>> I’d treat animation (or moving illustration) as a long-term stretch goal.
>> There’s science out there that suggests it’s not necessary. If it’s low
>> effort, sure, but most of it isn’t.
>>
>> See #2 here:
>> https://medium.com/ux-power-tools/heres-everything-i-ve-learned-from-designing-10-000-ui-screens-as-a-lead-product-designer-7d2810bee810
>>
>> —
>>
>> Ok, I still owe you a recreation of your current logo, some optimization
>> options, and a brand book.
>>
>> Happy Friday!
>>
>> On Fri, Jul 17, 2020 at 3:10 PM Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>>
>>> Some answers and links:
>>>
>>> *Where do I get the font?*
>>>
>>> Circular is kinda tricky to acquire since you can only buy it directly
>>> from the Swiss designer’s website. It’s also the most expensive of all the
>>> “top shelf” fonts at ~$200 USD per desktop license per weight. To license
>>> it for yourself, it’d be ~$400 for the Bold & Book weights. At bare
>>> minimum, I’d purchase the bold weight, and we can use a free, similar font
>>> for body copy.
>>>
>>> https://lineto.com/typefaces/circular
>>>
>>> —
>>>
>>> *What were our colors?*
>>>
>>> I’ll do a proper page in the brand book with these and their swatches,
>>> but here are the hex values for now:
>>>
>>> Deepwater #225566
>>> Water #22BBCC
>>> Shallow #BBDDDD
>>> Coral #EE7766
>>>
>>> —
>>>
>>> *What were those websites we looked at for inspiration?*
>>>
>>> https://ritual.com
>>> https://www.zocdoc.com
>>> https://www.drinktrade.com
>>>
>>> —
>>>
>>> *What was that pattern we saw for each section in the page?*
>>>
>>>    1. Frame  (bounding box, straight, slanted, wavy, etc.)
>>>    2. Large text
>>>    3. Small text
>>>    4. Call-to-action
>>>    5. Figure (symbol, illustration, photo, form, etc.)
>>>
>>> —
>>>
>>> *Where’s our file we made?*
>>>
>>> Right here:
>>> <CW-Sprint-Day-2.png>
>>>
>>> —
>>>
>>> Hope that helps! Had a blast working on it with you. Until next time.
>>>
>>> Matt
>>>
>>
>
> --
> Daylen Stoutin
>
> c: 205-614-2143
> e: daylen@clearwaterdata.solutions
>
>

We're excited to share an important milestone for Sprout Social: Today we
became a public company!

We started Sprout in 2010 to help our customers manage the transformation
as more than 3.4 billion consumers and tens of millions of brands made
social media a critical part of our lives. To do that, we've focused on

As we enter this next chapter, expect to see more of what you love from

Today is a proud day for our team, and we couldn't have done it without you.




Thank you.




Justyn Howard

subject: Re: Logo request
body:
Hey Celeste -

Thanks again for sending over this request. Re: their mood boards, the
first page depicts logos but the second page depicts the logo being used
within branding. Just to be clear, these would be separate projects. Once
we have the logo designed we can create additional branded designs (like
the hands holding the logo, etc). Does that make sense?

Our logo pricing for a ministry is $499 with the client agreeing to the
below expectations. Slides, ID's, or branded designs run $199-299 depending
on each project.

We have an intake form to fill out where the client can provide information
(similar to what they've already provided) to have a clear desire for the
project.

Based on what they've provided in the mood boards I think we can make them
happy! Let me know if you have any questions.

Warmly,
Meg


--


*ReBorn Principles & Communication Expectations**Constraints up front.*

   -

   Before design work begins, all design requirements and opinions of
   anyone who is speaking into the project should be submitted on the request
   form.
   -

   Revised constraints once project has commenced constitute a new billable
   project.

*No major revisions.*

   -

   After design work has been delivered, any change requests beyond small
   changes to initial constraints—like wording or date—are typically a sign of
   miscommunication or variance in subjective taste.


   -

   Major revisions may include changes to large text, image, position,
   size, or style.
   -

   Logo Systems will involve more ongoing input than any other design file
   requests.


*Our workflow is optimized to keep  design affordable for churches so we
avoid back-and-forth iteration, clients dictating design decisions, and
groupthink after work is delivered.*

On Fri, Oct 25, 2019 at 1:38 PM Celeste Cecchi <Celeste.Cecchi@covchurch.org>
wrote:

> Hey Matt,
>
>
>
> Here is the info I have received from the ministry initiative…
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------
>
>
>
> Here is a write-up describing what this initiative is and the why around
> it. I'm hoping this will be helpful to give you a picture of what it is
> we're trying to accomplish through this ministry initiative:
>
> *What is God calling us to?*
>
> We believe that the whole church is called to invest in the emerging
> generation of the future Church.
>
>
>
> *Where are we now and where do we want to go?*
>
> The ECC has had a strong legacy in investing in students, particularly
> through events like CHIC, gatherings at Covenant Camps, and resources like
> the Confirmation Curriculum.
>
>
>
> Churches within and outside of the denomination are seeing students become
> less engaged with the Church.
>
>
>
> The health and flourishing of youth ministry starts with youth workers and
> leaders. These individuals are typically younger, transitioning from being
> students themselves into a formal ministry role. These leaders are
> investing in the future of the Church while being part of the emerging
> generation themselves.
>
>
>
> We believe that with training and coaching, we will see
>
> -       More strategic and intentional ministry
>
> -       Sustainable models of life/ministry lifestyle
>
> -       Better understanding of the generations and how to minister to them
>
>
>
> We want to re-inspire, educate, and equip churches to have thriving youth
> ministries that create disciples that develop life-long journeys as they
> grow deeper in love with Jesus.
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------
>
> I asked them to provide some type of mood board so we could get a feel for
> the vibe they’re going for. Here’s the explanation they provided, and
> attached is a PDF of the two boards mentioned below.
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------
>
>
>
> Here are 2 mood boards that I put together. These are some general
> directions that came to mind as I was imaging what kind of visuals the
> cohort can take on.
>
> *Board 1:*
>
> ·         High contrast in colors. Right now it shows black, white, and
> red. I am not committed to that combo, but like the stark contrast.
>
> ·         upper right hand image is what I imagine the vibe of the
> gatherings to be like. Intimate, inspirational, authentic, and raw (not
> polished)
>
> ·         typography that conveys movement, evolution, fluid
>
>
> *Board 2:*
>
> ·         curious what it would look like to create a branding that
> includes photos that are of hands holding the message or brand
>
> ·         concept is roughly around bringing what we talk about into real
> life, living into the next step
>
> ·         maybe it's always something that is physical like the bottom
> right image where it's changeable text on a sign. basically something
> physical
>
> *What to avoid:*
> Nothing with arrows. We have an affiliate ministry who's main conference
> is called Next, where they integrate the arrow between the "E" and the "X."
> We want to stay away from that as much as possible.
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------
>
> They are just needing the initiative branded with a logo and color palette
> at this stage. And perhaps a suggestion for a font? For our January
> conference they are going to simply be represented with an ad on the big
> screen and a branded letter for youth pastors to take back to their
> churches to get their lead pastors on board (meaning, get them to pay) for
> the youth pastors to go through this program. The curriculum for the
> program is in the works too, but at this stage all we need is a logo to
> start working with for branding the initiative. Does that make sense? Let
> me know if you have any questions. If you could give us a ballpark of what
> this would cost by Tuesday, Oct. 29th that would be great. We’d like to
> have the design portion of the project wrapped up by the end of November so
> we can get the letters/envelopes branded, through editorial, and off to
> print by Dec 6th. I know Thanksgiving is thrown in there too, so is this
> a realistic timeframe?
>
>
>
> Thanks for considering the project! 😊
>
>
>
> Celeste Cecchi
>
> Project Manager, Communications
>
> The Evangelical Covenant Church
>
> (773) 907-3362
>
> celeste.cecchi@covchurch.org
>
> This electronic communication, including any attached documents, may
> contain confidential and/or legally privileged information that is intended
> only for use by the recipient(s) named above. If you have received this
> communication in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete the
> communication and any attachments.
>

subject: Re: Sample
body:
Thanks for sending, Celeste. This is definitely something we can do. Let me
run the timeline by Matt this evening. To clarify, is the logo / project
for a ministry called Next? Or NEXT? Or is it under another name?

Warmly,
Meg

On Fri, Oct 25, 2019 at 1:51 PM Celeste Cecchi <celeste.n.cecchi@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Ok so I just grabbed this file just to give you an idea of another project
> that was outsourced to a designer before I got here. The same higher up
> (exec level) hands are the ones that will be on this one too, so it may
> help to see what they've chosen to use in the past? This sample just helped
> me see what designers pass along at the end of the project since I haven't
> gone thru this process before now haha. It sounds like they're just wanting
> a simple logo/color scheme for now though -- so probably just like what's
> included on page one of this? Anyway, take a look at this and let me know
> if it helps. If not, you can ignore it ;) Obviously the design itself won't
> help since it's for a totally different ministry initiative. Just thought
> it would give you an idea of what they like?
>

Group map? Just before Tuesday PM would be perfect.

Thank you!
Meg

*RESTRICTED HAZARDOUS ITEMS*

To ensure the safety of our customers and employees, *Delta does not accept
smart bags.* Smart bags with non-removable lithium-ion batteries will not
be permitted as carry-on or checked baggage on any Delta mainline or Delta
Connection flight. For more information, please visit our News Hub
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=d7248bde724b6eb362a520ff086ca931e7c66f450ec0157ffaa47e4ee8e1e7c2839c9e91e297be10f5710e06c656596d5159fb5d310472796fde74e788743617>

All damaged, defective or recalled lithium batteries, including lithium
powered self-balancing transportation devices are not permitted as carry-on
or checked baggage.

Spare batteries for other devices, fuel cells, and e-cigarettes are
permitted in carry-on baggage only. If your carry-on bag contains these
items and is gate checked, they must be removed and carried in the cabin.
Further information and specific guidelines regarding restricted items can

*Terms & Conditions*

This ticket is non-refundable unless the original ticket was issued at a
fully refundable fare. Some fares may not allow changes. If allowed, any
change to your itinerary may require payment of a change fee and increased
fare. Failure to appear for any flight without notice to Delta will result
in cancellation of your remaining reservation.

Note: When using certain vouchers to purchase tickets, remaining credits
may not be refunded. Additional charges and/or credits may apply.

†All SkyMiles® program rules apply. To review the rules, see Membership
Guide & Program Rules. Taxes and fees for Award Travel are the
responsibility of the passenger and must be paid at the time the ticket is
booked. Award Travel seats are limited and may not be available on all
flights or in all markets. Offers void where prohibited by law. Other
restrictions may apply.

*Checked Bag Allowance*

*On Delta® operated flights, you may carry on one bag and a small personal
item at no charge.

Delta One®/First/Business Class weight allowance reverts to 50 lbs for all
checked bags beyond regular free allowance.

At the time of check in with Delta, SkyMiles Medallion members, SkyTeam
Elite & Elite Plus and active US Military personnel are eligible for fee
waivers and other benefits. For more details, visit delta.com/baggage
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=7878d42587be425a511231582481c0cfe182867520f020c9304590ff32736f4312c5c29f646228f497c81019c4d3ee99afe79d5a81bf8fe83e4c3cfb6dac58441391449a02fa39ad>.
Basic Cardmembers with a Gold, Platinum, or Reserve Delta SkyMiles Credit
Card from American Express are eligible for the first bag fee waiver. More
details on the program can be found at delta.com/firstbagfree
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=7878d42587be425a5f52d564cc45572a5c10f25e1c7899e45342bd7b89678ba2437ad4301bf2cf333d57936fc24beccaf84f065a3a4f6f12372a79ad099d9aaced3d057a6c4794e0>

A standard checked bag with Delta may be up to 50 lbs and 62 linear inches
(per piece). Additional fees apply for oversize, overweight, and/or
additional pieces of checked baggage. Please review Delta's baggage
guidelines for details. Weight and size restrictions may vary when checking
baggage on carriers other than Delta. Contact with the operating carrier
for detailed checked baggage allowances. You must be checked in at the gate
by the applicable check-in deadlines or your reservation may be cancelled.
Please review Delta's check-in requirement guidelines for details. Check-in
requirements vary by airline, so if your ticket includes travel on other
airlines, please check with the operating carrier on your ticket.

Do you have comments about our service? Please email
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=7878d42587be425a212bb6cd38270d1164a4ee8b67c846cc204178a3fa09058aba41db2b31d4dadb98113340d7cf4f948d84003add88df31df0da6989a19bc90>us
to share them.

*ADVICE TO INTERNATIONAL PASSENGERS ON LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY*

Passengers embarking upon a journey involving an ultimate destination or a
stop in a country other than the country of departure are advised that the
provisions of an international treaty (the Warsaw Convention, the 1999
Montreal Convention, or other treaty), as well as a carrier’s own contract
of carriage or tariff provisions, may be applicable to their entire
journey, including any portion entirely within the countries of departure
and destination. The applicable treaty governs and may limit the liability
of carriers to passengers for death or personal injury, destruction or loss
of, or damage to, baggage, and for delay of passengers and baggage.

Additional protection can usually be obtained by purchasing insurance from
a private company. Such insurance is not affected by any limitation of the
carrier’s liability under an international treaty. For further information
please consult your airline or insurance company representative.

*Conditions of Carriage*

Air transportation on Delta and the Delta Connection® carriers is subject
to Delta's conditions of carriage
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de59c612d0fab936868f44e8d87985c665d1f2637cb6680315ecf323ae7f8e8a3dead1bffd3f37dd67e1e5b0ddf2ba6e514c73f94c345efa1df>.
They include terms governing for example:

• Limits on our liability
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5aac3cf82e48bfbafac5e1693bcb54f3004b97a0989b15ddeed17dfb24d837a2cfa370433c71d5bd7317444c86b914bd4f0f519677283fb781f56e0a5b3c2aeaf>
for personal injury or death of passengers, and for loss, damage of delay
of goods and baggage.
• Claim restrictions
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5098210a67046bd8c10c5e54941732573a482bf25a996dcf88713968b7370dce313e1d74b79ec260617fa17b97f040dfc8447e423735cc57f28c400265fcbccbf>
including time periods within which you must file a claim or bring action
against us.
• Our right to change terms
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de567915ce9b659c0c81d8f88e2743cef92df07b6c47aab0cfde44ccf5b6724b2822484fe4e235c1e2c9d0c5563ed6e654e521e9068580a677f254a035b66e5bd90>
of the contract.
• Check-in requirements
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5bb96f2a526c7c2813bc51d36f30903c06f77828b1275e63f7e6aafa2c41344f2b3bcad8bf9cb3175a917dcbf1a9bc3fe8b7923d7c0d203c95492104e1049e278>
and other rules established when we may refuse carriage
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5c0e90e71c719de4f27962f113181b410c0d1e064568d000b9a133b9c562166a295649f8fc20f8ace225a7cfc5dce4f34bc403fb8b5c0c2b62e872739d4792ba5>
.
• Our rights and limits of our liability for delay or failure to perform
service
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5e2dc543aad3953c7d8106ee7163d7b0e6577cba9ed40d99e748ec296bf2fe03ff540d7bae4da73396867f70fc4a2cfcc5439c2e1c00dc0528d1e3ca734f0fcf9>
including schedule change, substitution of alternative air carriers or
aircraft, and rerouting.
• Our policy on overbooking flights
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5b5e6a51cf4a0201f3a644a8edcaf0f1fa8f6d5154836d70b675c698be914494e00a8f35101f8a08e8afbcb468552029544870916cf4200941e15c38846698158>,
and your rights if we deny you boarding due to an oversold flight.

These terms are incorporated by reference into our contract with you. You
may view these conditions of carriage on delta.com, or by requesting a copy
from Delta.

*Terms & Conditions*

This ticket is non-refundable unless the original ticket was issued at a
fully refundable fare. Some fares may not allow changes. If allowed, any
change to your itinerary may require payment of a change fee and increased

Note: When using certain vouchers to purchase tickets, remaining credits
may not be refunded. Additional charges and/or credits may apply.

†All SkyMiles® program rules apply. To review the rules, see Membership
Guide & Program Rules. Taxes and fees for Award Travel are the
responsibility of the passenger and must be paid at the time the ticket is
booked. Award Travel seats are limited and may not be available on all
flights or in all markets. Offers void where prohibited by law. Other
restrictions may apply.

*Checked Bag Allowance*

*On Delta® operated flights, you may carry on one bag and a small personal
item at no charge.

Delta One®/First/Business Class weight allowance reverts to 50 lbs for all
checked bags beyond regular free allowance.

At the time of check in with Delta, SkyMiles Medallion members, SkyTeam
Elite & Elite Plus and active US Military personnel are eligible for fee
waivers and other benefits. For more details, visit delta.com/baggage
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=7878d42587be425a511231582481c0cfe182867520f020c9304590ff32736f4312c5c29f646228f497c81019c4d3ee99afe79d5a81bf8fe83e4c3cfb6dac58441391449a02fa39ad>.
Basic Cardmembers with a Gold, Platinum, or Reserve Delta SkyMiles Credit
Card from American Express are eligible for the first bag fee waiver. More
details on the program can be found at delta.com/firstbagfree
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=7878d42587be425a5f52d564cc45572a5c10f25e1c7899e45342bd7b89678ba2437ad4301bf2cf333d57936fc24beccaf84f065a3a4f6f12372a79ad099d9aaced3d057a6c4794e0>

A standard checked bag with Delta may be up to 50 lbs and 62 linear inches
(per piece). Additional fees apply for oversize, overweight, and/or
additional pieces of checked baggage. Please review Delta's baggage
guidelines for details. Weight and size restrictions may vary when checking
baggage on carriers other than Delta. Contact with the operating carrier
for detailed checked baggage allowances. You must be checked in at the gate
by the applicable check-in deadlines or your reservation may be cancelled.
Please review Delta's check-in requirement guidelines for details. Check-in
requirements vary by airline, so if your ticket includes travel on other
airlines, please check with the operating carrier on your ticket.

Do you have comments about our service? Please email
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=7878d42587be425a212bb6cd38270d1164a4ee8b67c846cc204178a3fa09058aba41db2b31d4dadb98113340d7cf4f948d84003add88df31df0da6989a19bc90>us
to share them.

*ADVICE TO INTERNATIONAL PASSENGERS ON LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY*

Passengers embarking upon a journey involving an ultimate destination or a
stop in a country other than the country of departure are advised that the
provisions of an international treaty (the Warsaw Convention, the 1999
Montreal Convention, or other treaty), as well as a carrier’s own contract
of carriage or tariff provisions, may be applicable to their entire
journey, including any portion entirely within the countries of departure
and destination. The applicable treaty governs and may limit the liability
of carriers to passengers for death or personal injury, destruction or loss
of, or damage to, baggage, and for delay of passengers and baggage.

Additional protection can usually be obtained by purchasing insurance from
a private company. Such insurance is not affected by any limitation of the
carrier’s liability under an international treaty. For further information
please consult your airline or insurance company representative.

*Conditions of Carriage*

Air transportation on Delta and the Delta Connection® carriers is subject
to Delta's conditions of carriage
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de59c612d0fab936868f44e8d87985c665d1f2637cb6680315ecf323ae7f8e8a3dead1bffd3f37dd67e1e5b0ddf2ba6e514c73f94c345efa1df>.
They include terms governing for example:

• Limits on our liability
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5aac3cf82e48bfbafac5e1693bcb54f3004b97a0989b15ddeed17dfb24d837a2cfa370433c71d5bd7317444c86b914bd4f0f519677283fb781f56e0a5b3c2aeaf>
for personal injury or death of passengers, and for loss, damage of delay
of goods and baggage.
• Claim restrictions
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5098210a67046bd8c10c5e54941732573a482bf25a996dcf88713968b7370dce313e1d74b79ec260617fa17b97f040dfc8447e423735cc57f28c400265fcbccbf>
including time periods within which you must file a claim or bring action
against us.
• Our right to change terms
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de567915ce9b659c0c81d8f88e2743cef92df07b6c47aab0cfde44ccf5b6724b2822484fe4e235c1e2c9d0c5563ed6e654e521e9068580a677f254a035b66e5bd90>
of the contract.
• Check-in requirements
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5bb96f2a526c7c2813bc51d36f30903c06f77828b1275e63f7e6aafa2c41344f2b3bcad8bf9cb3175a917dcbf1a9bc3fe8b7923d7c0d203c95492104e1049e278>
and other rules established when we may refuse carriage
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5c0e90e71c719de4f27962f113181b410c0d1e064568d000b9a133b9c562166a295649f8fc20f8ace225a7cfc5dce4f34bc403fb8b5c0c2b62e872739d4792ba5>
.
• Our rights and limits of our liability for delay or failure to perform
service
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5e2dc543aad3953c7d8106ee7163d7b0e6577cba9ed40d99e748ec296bf2fe03ff540d7bae4da73396867f70fc4a2cfcc5439c2e1c00dc0528d1e3ca734f0fcf9>
including schedule change, substitution of alternative air carriers or
aircraft, and rerouting.
• Our policy on overbooking flights
<https://click.t.delta.com/?qs=a91a7a205b950de5b5e6a51cf4a0201f3a644a8edcaf0f1fa8f6d5154836d70b675c698be914494e00a8f35101f8a08e8afbcb468552029544870916cf4200941e15c38846698158>,
and your rights if we deny you boarding due to an oversold flight.

These terms are incorporated by reference into our contract with you. You

subject: Re: Church Flyer Design Work via myXP
body:
We are excited to have the opportunity to work with you on this project. I
sent a proposal + contract with pricing in a second email. Take a look and
let me know if you have any questions before we get started. Our current
timeline for this project is 3 weeks for completion of the printable file. *We
have access to competitive prices as well if you're interested in having
this printed through MyXP. *

*I have a few questions / additional requests to get us started:*

-Do you have preferred colors to use in this brochure? Colors to stay away
from?
-Do you have the logo files for Harvest Youth + Harvest Kids without the
color background?
-I'd love 3-4 print quality images. Is this something you already have or
could have someone take? We also have the option of using stock photos.

   - preaching image and/or a picture of the pastor
   - photo of people interacting at church (possibly talking in lobby or
   people coming to church / being greeted)
   - image of the kids or youth during class


Thanks,
Megan Born

__

subject: Re: Tuner Updates
body:
Great! Thanks for the update. I'll close this project for him! Do you still
have the original invoice or does it need to be updated based on how Matt's
work was used in the final product for the client?

Thanks, Kyle!
Meg



On Mon, Apr 15, 2019 at 6:46 AM Kyle Weber <contact@kylewebear.com> wrote:

> Hey Megan!
>
> Awesome! Glad he found something full-time!
>
> As for this project, I had to fine someone else, so nothing else needed.
>
> --
> *KYLE WEBER*
>
> # +1 847 767 0298 <+1%20847%20767%200298>
>
> On Apr 14, 2019, at 21:36, Matt Born <me@mattborn.com> wrote:
>
> Hey Kyle!
>
> This is Megan, checking in for Matt. I'm going to be helping him manage
> his freelance projects now that he has a full-time gig. Are you still
> missing pieces from Matt on this project that you could use help with or
> did you find someone else to wrap it up? If still needed, we can get a
> contract for the work and put it on his timeline. Let me know!
>
> Best,
> Megan Born
>
>
>
> On Mon, Feb 18, 2019 at 4:12 PM Kyle Weber <contact@kylewebear.com> wrote:
>
>> So, had a nice long talk with the client. I’ll try to do my best to
>> explain everything below, if I don’t i’ll try to explain for a quick screen
>> share if need be. Also attached the Matrices for the tuner again.
>>
>> I get why this would be confusing, as does he to a certain point. His
>> whole process currently with this is a long phone call with each person
>> he’s selling his services to, this turner cuts that conversation down
>> “tremendously”. With that being said, the only thing that makes sense to me
>> now is the Free Equipment dial being interactive as each, I’ll try to
>> explain in detail below.
>>
>> *Free Equipment Dial*
>>
>> 2-in-1 Bluetooth Card Reader
>> 3-in-1 Bluetooth Card Reader
>> Card Terminal
>> Smart Terminal
>> Online Methods
>> Your Point of Sale System
>>
>> Each dot on the knob should equal one of these. 6 in total (I know we
>> only have a max of 5 per, what does adding 1 more to free equipment, or all
>> of them mean?). The second table was for laying out which device goes with
>> each preset option. This makes sense to me as to why this dial should be
>> interactive.
>>
>> As for the rest of the tuner being interactive, I was able to explain to
>> him why it would be confusing overall. His argument is that he thinks it
>> would be weird having 1 dial be interactive, but for the rest not be
>> interactive, even though each dial has various dots, and are not equal. He
>> wants people to play around with this as they can answer their own
>> questions by messing around with it. I know this sounds weird, but I can
>> see as why he would want this. For him, it eliminates a lot steps.
>>
>> *The other stuff*
>>
>>
>>    1. The information icon should have a simple popover. I figured
>>    something like: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/components/popovers/ I
>>    tried to get it to work, but got nowhere.
>>    2. For the free equipment, there is an image attached to each option,
>>    all that needs to happen is the image changes on each option selected. You
>>    can see something in place here: http://staging.keenmerchant.com/
>>     Simple?
>>    3. I was messing around with your code a little here and there,
>>    trying to change the spacing and mess with the values. How hard is it to
>>    change the spacing of each dot if need be? What if I wanted to add another,
>>    what needs to happen?
>>    4. How’s this all suppose to work on mobile? If it doesn’t work
>>    across certain browser versions, I’ll just have to tell him so if I need
>>    to, no big deal.
>>
>>
>> My final thoughts, questions on this. I can see as to why he wants this
>> shit interactive, and I’m at a hold steady with convincing him we don’t
>> need it. However he may give in but at the moment he says he just needs to
>> see the final product and mess around with it. I want to make it
>> interactive, but at this point I just need to know how hard this may be. Is
>> it something you can do once, and show me how to do the rest?
>>
>> Lastly, I just want to apologize for any potential confusing I might be
>> bringing into this. I know there’s been a gap in time since we started
>> this, and your availability is limited, I’m all down for random sessions on
>> your time, but I’m also looking to getting this wrapped up ASAP in the next
>> 2-3 weeks so I can get you paid and this off your plate.
>>
